jd:
Intrinsic is Alphabet's bet aiming to reimagine the potential of industrial robotics. Our team believes that advances in AI, perception and simulation will redefine what's possible for industrial robotics in the near future – with software and data at the core.



Our mission is to make industrial robotics intelligent, accessible, and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a dynamic team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.

**Role**
--------



As a Product Manager Perception and Machine Learning, you will be at the forefront of bringing advanced AI capabilities to industrial automation. You collaborate with innovative partners and Intrinsic's product engineering, customer solutions engineering, product management, UX, and commercial teams to inject computer vision and other machine learning technologies into industrial robotics automation. You get to visit Intrinsic's partner and customer sites to fully understand problems and alternative solutions (travel requirements 10%). In this role, you bring our mission to life by letting the world reimagine what robots can do when they have the ability to see and learn.


**How your work moves the mission forward**
-------------------------------------------


* Work with customers to understand pain points in automation that can be solved with industrial perception and machine learning.
* Collaborate with our internal engineering teams and other product managers to translate needs into technical requirements.
* Prioritize requirements and deliver features incrementally, continuously gathering feedback from customers to maximize value.
* Contribute to building a product roadmap and communicate it to stakeholders, peers, and customers for internal and external alignment.
* Work with our internal user experience team (research and design) to pave the way for optimal UX.

**Skills you will need to be successful**
-----------------------------------------


* A bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent industry experience.
* A proven track record of success as a product manager or similar.
* Familiarity with computer vision and machine learning, optimally by applying it themselves in an industrial setting.
* Understanding the opportunities and limitations of working with machine learning in an industrial setting.
* Very good communication skills in both English and German, with customers, stakeholders, and peers.

**Skills that will differentiate your candidacy**
-------------------------------------------------


* M.S. in engineering.
* Deep familiarity with agile product management techniques.
* Experience with building software for robotics automation.
* Experience with building modular, scalable automation solutions.
* Experience with projects that involve significant research \\& development.


At Intrinsic, we don't just accept difference \\- we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.



If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at: candidate\\-support@intrinsic.ai.

jd:
### **About Staffbase**



We inspire people to achieve great things together. Our mission is to help organizations unlock the power of inspirational communication. **Our award\\-winning communications channels** \\- intranet, employee app and email \\- deliver experiences that drive engagement and inspire hearts and minds.



We're headquartered in Chemnitz, Germany, with offices in many locations throughout the world, including New York, London, Berlin and Dresden. Our international team counts more than 750 employees from 45\\+ nationalities and we have a growing base of 2200\\+ customers that want to transform their employee experience. We are rapidly scaling, post\\-Series E ($115 million funding), have strong\\-growing revenue, and our customers love us.


**Your Role**



As a founding Senior AI/LLM Engineer on our innovative Mission Control team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technical direction of our products. Your solutions will transform Staffbase customers into strategic storytellers and help measure impact of their communications. You will drive the development of scalable, robust ML\\-based systems that redefine customer's experiences.


**Our environment**


* Working with skilled and similar\\-minded professionals in a team that values diversity and inclusivity
* We aim to create a flexible and agile work environment that promotes the well\\-being and work\\-life balance of our employees
* We believe that team events during working hours play a vital role in building an exceptionally effective team, and we encourage them
* We are enthusiastic about technology and committed to using it to improve the world
* We follow the "You build it, you run it" approach and take pride in it


**What you'll be doing**


* **Build \\& Deploy ML Solutions**: Build and maintain scalable, secure, and reliable ML pipelines for processing large volumes of textual data. Work with orchestration tools (e.g., Dagster) to manage complex data workflows
* **Collaborate \\& Innovate**: Work cross\\-functionally with product, design, and engineering teams to create user\\-centric, ML\\-driven solutions
* **Experiment \\& Learn:** Run experiments, embrace fast failures, and iterate quickly for continuous product improvement
* **Mentor \\& Grow:** Share knowledge, support team growth, and stay ahead of AI trends to drive innovation


**What you need to be successful**


* 5\\+ years of experience in Machine Learning
* 2\\+ years of experience in Natural Language Processing
* 6\\+ months of experience with building applications leveraging Large Language Models
* Experience with MLOps best practices, model monitoring, and model versioning
* Experience working in a product team in a software development environment
* Proven experience leading ML projects, making strategic technical decisions, and mentoring engineers and data scientists
* Experience building and deploying ML models in cloud environments, utilizing containerization and orchestration tools
* Strong product\\-oriented thinking with a deep understanding of customer needs and domain\\-specific challenges
* Strong programming in and engineering skills, with the ability to design, build, and maintain scalable ML systems


**What you'll get**


* *Competitive Compensation* \\- we offer attractive salary packages including LTIP (unit\\-based Long Term Incentive Plan).
* *Flexibility* \\- we offer flexible working time models and the option of hybrid work, and support this with a yearly flex work allowance of €1560\\.
* *Growth Budget* \\- all employees get a yearly budget for external training of €1000, and one day off for growth per year (increase to two days in 2nd year).
* *Wellbeing* \\- in addition to our yearly vacation of 31 days, we're running a 4\\-day\\-work week every year in August with full payment.
* *Benefits platform* \\- Through the provider ThanksBen, all employees receive EUR 35 (tax\\-free) per month to spend on their well\\-being. This covers, for example, sports courses, massages and many retailers.
* *Support* **\\-** we're offering a company pension scheme.
* *Sports \\& Health* \\- join our sport courses in the offices. The offices are equipped with fruits, drinks and snacks.
* *Team Building* \\- Regular team and office events including the yearly Staffbase Camp.
* *Volunteers Day*\\- you'll get one day off per year for supporting a social project.
* *Employee Referral Program* \\- one of your friends is a fit to one of our full\\-time openings? Refer them and get a referral bonus paid.

jd:
As a global semiconductor leader in power systems and IoT, we enable game\\-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. That's why you probably use our products every day: smartphone, charger, electric toothbrush, coffee machine, refrigerator, remote control and much more. We are seeking a highly motivated and talented student to join our team as a Developer Web Applications. We are looking forward to your application!
  

  

**Job description**  

* **Shape the future** : You will be part of our front\\-end development team to create state\\-of\\-the\\-art management interfaces for our IoT systems.
* **Take responsibility** : You will work closely with the whole team \\- developers, architects and business developers – to build the optimal solution that matches the given requirements.
* **Expand your horizons** : Along the job you will learn a lot about our field of work (IoT fleet management, semiconductor industry) and about modern software development methods.
* **Teamwork is dreamwork** : You will be a valuable partner to all team members. You share your knowledge and learn from others.

  

  

**Your Profile**  

* **Study field** : You are currently studying Computer Science, Information Technology or similar
* **Knowledge** : You have good knowledge of UI web frameworks (React or VueJS) and already finished small projects.
* **Skills** :You have already gained practical experience with standard software development tools (GIT, IDE, Docker, Shell). You also have a basic understanding of the architecture of distributed software systems.
* **Experience** : You possess experience of communication in the field of software development. E.g. documenting software, explaining your implementations to other developers or stakeholders, provide feedback about the work of others.
* **Way of working** : You can work effectively in an international team environment.
* **Language skills** : You have fluent English skills, both written and spoken, German is a plus

Please attach the following documents to your application:
  

* CV in English
* Certificate of enrollment at university
* Latest grades transcript (not older than 6 months)
* High school report

Important information:
  

* **Working part\\-time** : The focus is on studies. Therefore, working student is possible during the lecture period with a maximum of 20 hours per week.
* **Proper students (according to the German law) are welcome** : You must be enrolled, and the examination results or modules of your studies must not have been completed yet, so that you can still work in our team for at least 6 months. You must also not be in a semester of leave.
* **You should live close to the site** : It is important for us to work with you on site and to integrate you into the team. You should therefore be able to come to the site regularly.

  

  

  

**Contact:**   

Rahel Tews
  

  

**Further links:*** Find out what we are looking for in your CV
* Find out how the student application process works with us
* Discover our student website

**\\#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.**  

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game\\-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.
  

**Are you in?**  

  

The **Development Center Dresden** was launched in 2019 and is growing successfully. Today, more than 180 top\\-class experts and young talents from 27 nations are working on research and development of new products and solutions for automotive and power electronics, software, chip design and verification, characterization of complex systems as well as development of products and solutions with artificial intelligence. In the long term, the Development Centre will employ around 250 people. State\\-of\\-the\\-art research and characterization labs facilitate R\\&D activities for automotive applications, electromobility and AI chips of the next but one generation. The Development Center covers the complete development value chain from product and system definition to qualification.
  

This is the right place for you, if you want to work in a high\\-tech environment, master challenges of advanced product development, be part of a multicultural team with great spirit and experience a startup\\-like culture.
  

Click here for more information about working at DC Dresden with interesting employee and management insights and an overview with more Jobs at \\#DCDresden.
  

  

**We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.**  

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills.
  

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.
  

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.
  

  

Click here for more information about Diversity \\& Inclusion at Infineon.

**Job Description Summary**
 We’re Sonesta International Hotels!
   

  

 We're the 8th largest hotel group in the US and, we're growing! Our mission is to wow every guest, team member, partner and community in which we operate by delivering exceptional hospitality! From our hotels to corporate offices, from the boardroom to the guest room, you’ll find a group of like\\-minded people, working together to build something great.
   

  

 What experience can you expect?
   

  

 Sonesta interns will work in one of our corporate departments for a 10\\-week period. During this time, you will get to work on exciting projects whilst deepening your understanding of hospitality and learn how we bring our hotel experiences to life! There will be plenty of opportunities for continued learning and development along the way!
   

  

 This opportunity will be based in our corporate HQ in Newton, MA, Monday\\-Thursday 9am\\-5pm.
   

  

**Job Description**
**The great things you’ll do!**
* Create a guest\\-facing or internal web UI using React.js
* Collaborate via GitHub—branches, pull requests, code reviews, and issues
* Learn GraphQL fundamentals: queries, mutations, fragments, variables
* Learn UX best practices (e.g., feedback loops, intuitive navigation)
* Learn how to communicate technical work to technical and non\\-technical audiences
* Learn agile methodologies and participate in daily standups and agile ceremonies
* Work within Sonesta’s guiding principles: Go Beyond and Do the Right Thing.
* Represent Sonesta in a professional manner with fellow employees and external parties or vendors during work\\-related activities.


**The requirements:**
* You must be a current undergraduate student enrolled in a 4\\-year college or university program in Hospitality, or a related field that directly aligns to the opportunity.
* Minimum 3\\.0 GPA
* You’ll be available to work onsite 4 days per week at our corporate office location in Newton, MA.
* Eager to learn, highly motivated, and willingness to be an active part of a team
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Experience working with Microsoft Office Suite Software (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook)


**Additional Job Information/Anticipated**
**Pay Range**
 Pay up to $15\\.00 per hour
   

  

**Benefits**
 Sonesta recognizes that benefits play a vital role in helping ensure the health and financial security of employees and their families. We offer a variety of benefits to our employees including:
   

  

* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Health Savings Account with Company Match
* 401(k) Retirement Plan with Company Match
* Paid Vacation and Sick Days
* Sonesta Hotel Discounts
* Educational Assistance
* Paid Parental Leave
* Company Paid Life Insurance
* Company Paid Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
* Various Employee Perks and Discounts
* Hospital Indemnity
* Critical Illness Insurance
* Accident Insurance


**Sonesta is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.**
**Upon submitting your application, please ensure you complete a full application in addition to attaching a resume. Incomplete applications received will not be considered.**

jd:
**About Alpine IQ**
 AIQ, also referred to as Alpine IQ, was established in 2019 with a clear vision: to revolutionize customer data compliance within heavily regulated industries.
   

  

 Over time, our tool naturally evolved into a comprehensive suite of products designed to address a variety of critical challenges faced by retailers. Our solutions empower businesses to streamline core operations and make informed decisions with ease, eliminating the uncertainties around customer demographics and preferences.
   

  

 We cater to organizations of all scales, from small family\\-owned enterprises to large publicly listed corporations, ensuring that our solutions are accessible and beneficial to businesses of every size.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a
 ****Front End Software Engineer (Level 2\\)****
 to join our fully remote engineering team. In this role, you'll be hands\\-on with coding and debugging, collaborating closely with our product and engineering teams to build new features and improve existing ones across both web and native apps.
   

  

 You'll take ownership of your work from ideation to deployment, and be an active contributor to a high\\-performing team. We"re looking for someone who thrives in a fast\\-paced environment, is passionate about clean, maintainable code, and enjoys solving tough technical problems.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for an experienced front\\-end engineer who wants to grow their impact, mentor junior engineers, and contribute meaningfully to a product with real\\-world reach.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Build \\& Ship: Write high\\-quality, scalable code for new features across web and native platforms.
* Maintain \\& Improve: Refactor and optimize legacy code for better performance and reliability.
* Troubleshoot: Diagnose and resolve bugs and technical issues quickly and efficiently.
* Collaborate: Work closely with fellow engineers and product managers to design, scope, and implement new features.
* Mentor: Support and coach junior engineers through code reviews and knowledge sharing.
* Innovate: Stay current with emerging front\\-end trends and suggest ways to improve tooling and workflows.


**What Success Looks Like**
* You"re writing clean, well\\-tested JavaScript/TypeScript code using React and React Native.
* You"re proactively identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks and bugs.
* You collaborate effectively across teams and communicate clearly.
* You"re mentoring others and contributing to a healthy, inclusive engineering culture.
* You're delivering features that align with both technical and product goals.


**Required Skills**
****What We're Looking For****
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript
* Deep experience with React and React Native (via Expo)
* Comfortable consuming and working with REST APIs
* Familiar with modern testing frameworks such as Jest, Cypress, and Testing Library
* Knowledge of Git and version control best practices
* Ability to write clean, maintainable, and testable code
* Awareness of security best practices in software development
* Experience with performance optimization for front\\-end applications


**Bonus Skills**
* Familiarity with Next.js and Vercel
* Backend development experience in Go or Node.js
* Scripting experience (Python, Bash, etc.)
* Containerization knowledge with tools like Docker
* Experience collaborating with design teams using Figma


**Experience \\& Education**
* 3\\+ years of hands\\-on experience as a software engineer
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field (not required)


****Why You'll Love Working Here****
* 100% remote team – work from anywhere within the U.S.
* Collaborative and supportive engineering culture
* Opportunities to grow your skills and shape our technical direction
* Meaningful work with a product that impacts thousands of user


****Ready to apply?****
 If you"re excited about building great front\\-end experiences and want to be part of a driven, remote\\-first team, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

****You will need to complete an assessment to be considered for this role. Follow this link:****
 https://app.testgorilla.com/s/f2ii1rc0
   

  

**The Pay Range For This Role Is**
 110,000 \\- 120,000 USD per year(Remote (Denver, Colorado, US))
   

  

 PI269777020

jd:
**A Day In The Life**
 When you begin your job with us working on the front\\-end as a courtesy clerk, customer service associate, or cashier, you are taking a step towards an opportunity that can help you learn, grow, and even develop a long\\-lasting career! We know you're choosing to invest your time with us, and we are committed to doing the same for you through on\\-the\\-job and online learning opportunities! Whether you are here for your first job or your last, from groceries to health needs, you guide, inspire, and make all customers' visit memorable. We build belonging by creating a diverse and inclusive workforce so, if you have smiles to share, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Table**
* You take pride in the work you do, whether big or small.
* You believe that food is central to all our lives.
* Helping customers and fellow associates gives you energy.
* Smiling and making others smile is your favorite.
* You are eager, willing, and wanting to learn \\& grow.
* You believe that being a part of your community matters.


**Why You Will Choose Us**
 Albertsons Companies Inc. has always been a people\\-oriented business, and thoughtful people practices remain a core element of our company’s philosophy. Our goal is to continue to bring people together around the joys of food and to inspire well\\-being and that starts with people like you bringing your unique self to our company and making it one person stronger and better!
   

  

**We Also Provide a Variety Of Benefits Including**
* Diverse \\& Inclusive Work Culture
* Competitive Wages Paid Weekly
* Flexible work schedules
* Associate discounts
* Leaders invested in your training, career growth \\& development.
* Health and welfare benefits for eligible employees (Medical, Dental, 401k and more!)
* Vacation / Paid Time Off


**Our Values**
* We put people first.
* We are customer driven.
* We value different perspectives.
* We raise the bar.
* We act as owners.
* We are one team.
* We build belonging.
* We are committed to a healthy future.

jd:
**Company Overview** 




 Eeze is at the forefront of the iGaming industry and is expanding its presence in the European market. We are a Live Casino provider dedicated to designing, developing, and delivering immersive games tailored to various brands and audiences.
 



**Job Summary** 




 As a Junior Frontend Developer at Eeze Malta, you will be part of a dynamic team developing cross\\-browser web applications for the gaming industry. You'll work with technologies such as TypeScript, React, Redux, and MUI while learning from experienced developers. This role is perfect for motivated individuals eager to grow their skills in a fast\\-paced, supportive environment.
 



**Main Responsibilities** 



* Assist in developing frontend applications using React and TypeScript for our gaming products
* Learn and contribute to our modular frontend architecture
* Collaborate with senior developers to understand and implement UI/UX designs
* Help maintain existing codebases and participate in code reviews to improve your skills
* Support testing and debugging of web applications
* Document your work and adhere to team coding standards



**Requirements** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or related field (or equivalent practical experience)
* Basic knowledge of React and JavaScript/TypeScript
* Understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design principles
* Familiarity with version control systems, preferably Git
* Eagerness to learn and ability to adapt to new technologies quickly
* Good problem\\-solving skills and attention to detail
* Basic understanding of programming principles (OOP, functional programming)



**Nice\\-to\\-Have Skills** 



* Experience with state management libraries (Redux, Context API)
* Familiarity with UI component libraries (MUI, Styled Components)
* Basic understanding of RESTful APIs and how to interact with them
* Some experience with Agile methodologies
* Interest in the gaming industry



**Benefits** 



* Structured mentorship program with experienced developers
* Training and learning opportunities to advance your technical skills
* Opportunity to work on real products in an exciting industry
* Flexible working hours in a hybrid setup
* Clear growth path for professional advancement within the company

jd:
**About Alpine IQ**
 AIQ, also referred to as Alpine IQ, was established in 2019 with a clear vision: to revolutionize customer data compliance within heavily regulated industries.
   

  

 Over time, our tool naturally evolved into a comprehensive suite of products designed to address a variety of critical challenges faced by retailers. Our solutions empower businesses to streamline core operations and make informed decisions with ease, eliminating the uncertainties around customer demographics and preferences.
   

  

 We cater to organizations of all scales, from small family\\-owned enterprises to large publicly listed corporations, ensuring that our solutions are accessible and beneficial to businesses of every size.
   

  

****Only candidates who complete this assessment will be evaluated for this role. Follow this****
****link****
****.****
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a
 ****Front End Software Engineer (Level 2\\)****
 to join our fully remote engineering team. In this role, you’ll be hands\\-on with coding and debugging, collaborating closely with our product and engineering teams to build new features and improve existing ones across both web and native apps.
   

  

 You’ll take ownership of your work from ideation to deployment, and be an active contributor to a high\\-performing team. We're looking for someone who thrives in a fast\\-paced environment, is passionate about clean, maintainable code, and enjoys solving tough technical problems.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for an experienced front\\-end engineer who wants to grow their impact, mentor junior engineers, and contribute meaningfully to a product with real\\-world reach.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Build \\& Ship: Write high\\-quality, scalable code for new features across web and native platforms.
* Maintain \\& Improve: Refactor and optimize legacy code for better performance and reliability.
* Troubleshoot: Diagnose and resolve bugs and technical issues quickly and efficiently.
* Collaborate: Work closely with fellow engineers and product managers to design, scope, and implement new features.
* Mentor: Support and coach junior engineers through code reviews and knowledge sharing.
* Innovate: Stay current with emerging front\\-end trends and suggest ways to improve tooling and workflows.


**What Success Looks Like**
* You're writing clean, well\\-tested JavaScript/TypeScript code using React and React Native.
* You're proactively identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks and bugs.
* You collaborate effectively across teams and communicate clearly.
* You're mentoring others and contributing to a healthy, inclusive engineering culture.
* You’re delivering features that align with both technical and product goals.


**Required Skills**
****What We’re Looking For****
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript
* Deep experience with React and React Native (via Expo)
* Comfortable consuming and working with REST APIs
* Familiar with modern testing frameworks such as Jest, Cypress, and Testing Library
* Knowledge of Git and version control best practices
* Ability to write clean, maintainable, and testable code
* Awareness of security best practices in software development
* Experience with performance optimization for front\\-end applications


**Bonus Skills**
* Familiarity with Next.js and Vercel
* Backend development experience in Go or Node.js
* Scripting experience (Python, Bash, etc.)
* Containerization knowledge with tools like Docker
* Experience collaborating with design teams using Figma


**Experience \\& Education**
* 3\\+ years of hands\\-on experience as a software engineer
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field (not required)


****Why You’ll Love Working Here****
* 100% remote team – work from anywhere within the U.S.
* Collaborative and supportive engineering culture
* Opportunities to grow your skills and shape our technical direction
* Meaningful work with a product that impacts thousands of user


****Ready to apply?****
 If you're excited about building great front\\-end experiences and want to be part of a driven, remote\\-first team, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**The Pay Range For This Role Is**
 110,000 \\- 120,000 USD per year(Remote (Denver, Colorado, US))

jd:
As a Front\\-End Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role in crafting intuitive, AI\\-enhanced user interfaces that power our website, checkout flows, and both the admin and client portals. You will collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to implement scalable, reusable components that support AI\\-driven interactions, and that make it faster and easier to add new products and features.
   

  

 This role requires expertise in Next.js and modern UI frameworks, a modular approach to front\\-end architecture, and the ability to work with conditional logic for dynamic document and scenario handling. You will also be responsible for integrating AI\\-driven customer workflows and contributing to API research and integration as our service offerings expand.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Develop and maintain Next.js applications
* Work closely with designers and translate UI/UX designs into functional interfaces, ensuring an understanding of the intended user experience, accessibility, and design goals
* Implement modular and scalable front\\-end architecture to ensure rapid feature development and easy expansion
* Research, analyze, and recommend third\\-party APIs as potential service integrations
* Maintain and improve authentication workflows
* Integrate with backend APIs
* Ensure clean, maintainable, and well\\-documented code for future scalability
* Deploy and manage demo versions in Vercel for QA testing
* Monitor and optimize performance using Sentry and other tracking tools


**Requirements**
 Core Technical Skills
   

  

* Next.js
* TypeScript \\& JavaScript
* MUI
* Sass
* Apollo GraphQL Client
* GitHub \\& Vercel
* Auth0


 Nice\\-to\\-Haves
   

  

* Experience with Node.js / NestJS
* Experience working with wireframes, prototypes, and design systems in Figma
* Exposure to Puppeteer
* Experience with Sentry, Mailgun, and EasyPost


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience in a Frontend position
* Excellent communication skills
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal


**Benefits**
 Why Join Us?
   

  

* Be part of a company revolutionizing government interactions with cutting\\-edge AI
* Collaborate with a dynamic team and have a direct impact on shaping our technical strategy
* Join at a critical growth phase with plans to expand and professionalize further
* Paid Time Off (PTO) and federal holidays
* Opportunities for professional growth in a fast\\-paced startup environment
* Equinox Membership
* Healthcare Coverage


 Location: On\\-site in Miami, FL (Brickell)
   

  

 If this role excites you, we'd love to hear from you! Let's create a future where interacting with government services is as simple as sending a text.

jd:
We are the teams who create all of Meta's products used by billions of people around the world. Want to build new features and improve existing products like Messenger, Video, Groups, News Feed, Search and more? Want to solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems? Meta is seeking experienced Front end Software Engineers to join our product teams. You can help build products that help us connect the next billion people, create new features that have billions of interactions per day and be a part of a team that’s working to help people connect with each other around the globe. Join us!
   

  

 Software Engineer, Front End Responsibilities:
   

  

* Lead complex technical or product efforts involving many engineers
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to peers
* Implement the features and user interfaces of Facebook products like News Feed
* Architect efficient and reusable front\\-end systems that drive complex web applications
* Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to deliver compelling user\\-facing products
* Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues


 Minimum Qualifications:

Job Details
   

  

**Description**
* No agencies or 3rd party Recruiters please. Thank you!\\*\\*\\*


**Who We Are**
 Cornerstone Capital Bank is a new bank, with over $330 million in capital and $2 billion in total assets and arises from the combination of mortgage industry giant Cornerstone Home Lending and community banking standout Roscoe State Bank. You’ll be on the front end of working for an innovative large community bank that is a leader in mortgage lending and community banking and growing in middle\\-market commercial and real estate lending.
   

  

 We honor
 **God** 
 by using our talents to make a
 **positive difference** 
 in the lives of our Team Members, Clients, Shareholders, Communities, and the People who provide services to us.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 Cornerstone Capital Bank is looking for a a skilled Front\\-End Web Developer to join our team in the marketing division. The ideal candidate will have hands\\-on experience in creating responsive and engaging web pages using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Familiarity with WordPress and/or Umbraco CMS, as well as proficiency in PHP or C\\# for customizing these platforms, is highly desirable.
   

  

* Location: Onsite in Galleria Area of Houston, TX
* Schedule: Hybrid
* Travel: N/A


**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain front\\-end code using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create responsive, user\\-friendly websites.
* Collaborate with marketing and design teams to implement and improve web content and user experiences.
* Customize and extend WordPress (PHP) or Umbraco (C\\#) CMS for various projects, ensuring compatibility and performance.
* Optimize websites for maximum speed and scalability.
* Debug and troubleshoot technical issues across multiple browsers and devices.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and new technologies to enhance web development practices.


**What You’ll Need To Be Successful**
* Bachelor Degree in relatable field preferred
* High School Diploma or equivalent required
* Minimum 2\\+ years of relevant front\\-end web development experience
* Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
* Experience with front\\-end frameworks and libraries (e.g., Bootstrap, jQuery)
* Familiarity with WordPress and/or Umbraco CMS
* Knowledge of PHP (for WordPress) or C\\# (for Umbraco) is a plus
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) required
* Basic knowledge of SEO principles and web accessibility standards required
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs and JSON preferred
* Understanding of responsive design principles and cross\\-browser compatibility
* Ability to work in a collaborative team environment
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and attention to detail


**What We Offer**
 Because we recognize and reward hard work, we offer a competitive salary, a full benefits package, and the potential for a performance\\-based bonus.
   

  

**What To Do Next**
 If Cornerstone sounds like the place for you (and if you have the qualifications, drive, and passion to match), we invite you to become a member of our winning team! And remember, once you're a part of our Cornerstone team, we'll continue to invest in you as a valuable asset to our company. As many of our team members can tell you, there's something special about working at Cornerstone.

Calling all Front End Developers! If you're looking for an exciting opportunity to play a critical role in our organization and would like to join a fast\\-paced innovative team, then you've come to the right place! At
 **Piper** 
 , we're searching for a passionate Software Engineers with emphasis in Front End Development to join our team in San Diego, CA.
   

  

 You will get to enjoy a reliable schedule, working
 **Monday \\- Friday from 8:30am to 5:00pm** 
 . We are offering a pay range of
 **$38\\.00 \\- $42\\.00 per hour for this position** 
 .
   

  

 But that's not all we offer! You can also enjoy these excellent benefits and perks:
   

  

* Medical insurance with $400 toward your monthly premium
* Employer\\-paid vision and dental
* Employee assistance program
* Life insurance
* 401(k) plan with an employer match
* 13 paid holidays, paid vacation, and sick time


 If you think this job is a fit for what you are looking for, applying is a snap. This initial application should take you less than 3 minutes to complete.
   

  

**WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT US?**
 We are a leading provider of advanced rail positioning and safety systems for the transit industry. Our expertise lies in offering innovative solutions for train navigation, Maintenance of Way (MOW) vehicle protection, and railway safety. Our enthusiasm for all things trains is evident in our daily discussions, and we embrace the use of Slack channels to spark spontaneous conversations and knowledge sharing. At Piper, we offer a supportive and diverse work culture that values collaboration and innovation. Join our team and help us make a difference!
   

  

**DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**
 We are searching for a Front End Developer whose primary function will be developing and maintaining websites and web applications that play a critical role with efficiencies and safe operation of transportation systems. This role requires a blend of technical proficiency, industry\\-specific knowledge, leadership skills, and a proactive approach to innovation and problem\\-solving.
   

  

**Here's What You'll Need**
* Build and maintain web dashboards both internal and customer\\-facing.
* Build and maintain React Native apps targeting both iOS and Android for mobile and tablet environments
* 3\\+ years of active Software Development as a Developer.
* Full life cycle software development experience.
* 2\\+ years of experience writing/working with modern JavaScript, Bootstrap, CSS, and HTML
* 2\\+ years of experience working and developing applications in modern JavaScript libraries such as React, React Native, and Angular.
* Experience working with jQuery
* A portfolio or live examples of code produced.
* Experience with GIT and familiarity with code versioning practices on large teams, i.e., branching strategies, pull requests, code reviews, etc.
* Experience working with wireframing/design tools like Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD to take approved designs and implement them into code.
* Strong understanding of web and browser technologies such as web sockets, service workers, LocalStorage, SessionStorage, and W3C manifests.
* Experience with consuming Web Services (GraphML, REST, XML Feeds, SOAP, etc).
* Self\\-starter, who demonstrates personal initiative.
* Excellent communication and organization skills.
* Ability to maintain a positive work attitude and willingness to help others.


**Qualifications**
* A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. Advanced degrees can be beneficial.
* 3\\+ years of experience in software engineering.
* Prior experience in the transportation industry is highly beneficial.


**READY TO APPLY?**
 Don't miss the chance to join Piper and bring your exceptional development skills to our team. Apply today and let's create something extraordinary together!
   

  

 Salary: $38 \\- $42 per hour
   

  

*Job Posted by ApplicantPro*

jd:
**At Moss, we give finance professionals the power to automate their day\\-to\\-day and make forward\\-thinking decisions.**

**Our team and culture make us unique — we’re driven by impact and growth, where every one of us strives to learn and excel. Recognised by** **Sifted’s Rising 100** **and** **LinkedIn's Top Startups****, we’re here to help propel your career and together, make Moss a lasting success.**


Our **Financial Services Tribe** is seeking a (**Senior) Frontend Engineer** (f/m/d) to build and scale customer onboarding, open\\-banking, wallet management, payments and treasury UX workflows. Collaborating closely with product managers, designers and backend engineers, you will bring innovative ideas to life, ensuring our product provides a delightful user\\-friendly experience and empowers users with intuitive and efficient tools.

**Your responsibilities**


Here's a bit more on what you can expect to be doing day\\-to\\-day:

* **Frontend Development:** Lead the development of the frontend application, ensuring it aligns with the approved designs and meets performance and usability standards. Proactively provide regular updates on work progress, achievements and challenges to product managers (PMs) and designers.
* **Collaborative Planning:** Partner with PMs and designers during project kick\\-offs to gain a comprehensive understanding of the overall vision, user needs, and goals. Provide valuable insights to refine UI/UX concepts and contribute to the planning of frontend development.
* **Backend Collaboration:** Collaborate closely with backend engineers to determine required APIs and backend functionality. Maintain clear communication channels to ensure smooth integration of frontend and backend components.
* **Testing and Quality Assurance:** Produce well tested and reliable code. Writing unit and functional (end\\-to\\-end) tests**.**
* **Rollout and Performance Monitoring:** Collaborate with product managers to devise efficient rollout strategies for new features. Monitor frontend performance and user feedback to identify areas for improvement and proactively address potential issues.

**About you**


We think you’ll need the following **experience and qualifications** to succeed in this role:

* Proven experience as a Frontend Engineer, working on complex UI\\-heavy applications.
* Proficiency in frontend development technologies, latest features and best practices such as React/TypeScript, as well as front\\-end development design patterns and techniques.
* Hands\\-on experience with frontend testing approaches and libraries (i.e. Testing Library, visual snapshot testing).
* Understanding of Rest API design principles.
* You are fluent in English


In addition, here are the **skills and attributes** we are looking for:

* **Pragmatic Tech Enthusiast:** You have the theoretical and practical background to engineer our product. You pursue quality and scalability and follow industry and company best practices. You build systems that are easy to maintain and to understand by others.
* **Delivery Focused:** You understand and focus on what is important to deliver the most impact. This means accurate development and delivery estimations, ruthless prioritization and saying no to less important things. You are driven to deliver tangible outcomes within estimated timelines, and you swiftly tackle challenges, and provide clear direction to others.
* **Collaborative Communicator:** You convey information effectively to a variety of audiences, and actively participate in daily meetings, keeping others informed about your progress and status. You’re able to form trustworthy connections by creating and maintaining open communication with colleagues throughout the development process.
* **Inquisitive Mindset:** You seek to develop a deep domain knowledge by proactively seeking to understand accounting customer workflows and technical intricacies. You’re curious and unafraid to question assumptions and propose alternative approaches, ensuring the product is tailored to meet customer needs.
* **Team Player**: You bring a team together to work towards a shared goal, as well as support individuals throughout all phases of a project.

**About Moss**


Moss is a SaaS scale\\-up founded in Berlin, with a team of 250\\+ people from 40\\+ nationalities in 6 offices across Europe.


Our ambition is bold: to power every SMB’s spend across Europe \\- fully digital, AI\\-driven, and seamlessly integrated for complete control. To date, over 3700 businesses in Germany, Netherlands and the UK use Moss’ leading spend management product, with modules such as corporate cards, accounts payables, employee cash reimbursements and procurement.


Moss has raised a total of €180 million in funding and is backed by the most renowned tech investors including Valar Ventures, Tiger Global, Global Founders Capital, Cherry Ventures and A\\-Star.


Be part of a culture that thrives on impact and speed, where you can take bold moves, learn fast and accomplish more. We’re a place where you can fast track your career \\- here's **what else to expect:**

* Top\\-of\\-market compensation package, including equity.
* Our vibrant offices are at the heart of our culture, where in\\-person time fuels collaboration and connection over weekly breakfasts and Friday demos.
* Additional benefits include: 20 days “work from abroad”, 600EUR/GBP Learning \\& Development Budget, and other local benefits.

***By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our*** ***Data Privacy Policy******.***

Welcome to Arbio – where AI meets hospitality, and every day is a step toward redefining short\\-term rentals across Europe.


Arbio is a fast\\-growing, AI\\-enabled hospitality company. We are redefining the short\\-term rental industry through technology\\-driven efficiency, exceptional guest experience, and scalable operations. As a team, we're shaping the future of hospitality with cutting\\-edge AI solutions, expanding rapidly across Europe, and building on a culture of performance and accountability. Join us as we lead the industry and create opportunities for growth, innovation, and success.

  

As a **Senior Software Engineer (Node.js)**, you'll tackle complex challenges, from crafting compelling front\\-end applications to integrating with diverse providers and scaling our AWS cloud infrastructure. You'll play a pivotal role in ensuring our platform is scalable, secure, and high\\-performing.

 **You will have an impact on:**

* **Design and Implement:** Architect scalable, secure, and high\\-performance systems for our platform.
* **Collaborate:** Work closely with Product Managers, UI/UX Designers, and stakeholders to deliver exceptional customer value.
* **Work with Cutting\\-Edge Tech:** Develop in a data\\-intensive, distributed environment using NodeJS, TypeScript, React and AWS services.
* **Innovate:** Design and build new functionality while improving existing systems.
* **Establish Best Practices:** Define and implement frameworks and processes that empower the team to excel.
* **Lead by example** by writing clean, testable code and supporting engineering best practices.
* **Decision\\-Making:** Actively contribute to team decisions regarding goals, timelines, and technology stack.
* **Own features end\\-to\\-end** — from architecture to implementation, deployment, and monitoring.
* **Improve performance, reliability, and scalability** to ensure our platform meets enterprise\\-grade standards.

 **What you will add to our Crew:**

* **5\\+ years of professional experience** in software development, preferably in full\\-stack roles.
* Proficiency in **TypeScript, Next.js/React, Node.js, MySQL, and AWS**.
* **Strong software engineering principles**: clean code, modularity, testing, and maintainability.
* Experience designing and maintaining **scalable, distributed systems**.
* **Self\\-motivated** and able to navigate a **fast\\-changing startup environment**.
* **Excellent communication skills** in English (both written and spoken).
* **Bonus:** Experience with ReactNative/Expo is a plus.

 **Our current benefits**

* **Work Environment \\& Support:** Flexible working hours with a flexible work set\\-up combining office \\& remote work
* **Food \\& Beverage:** Free drinks, fruit and veggie baskets, beer, and pizza after All Hands
* **Sport:** Subsidized Qualitrain Subscription (includes: unlimited Beat81 classes, Holmes Place, Yoga studios, Boulder Halls, etc.
* **Mental Well\\-being:** Access to our mental health platform offering regular 1o1 sessions with coaches, trainers and psychologists
* **Travelling:** Free yearly stay in one of our apartments of your choice
* **Tech:** Possibility to choose between Windows Lenovo or Macbook
* **Culture:** Yearly Company Offsites, regular team events, Christmas party, summer party, budget for your birthday

 **What joining the Arbio Squad means for you**  

You will be part of a dynamic team of top\\-tier professionals from every domain, all united by a relentless drive. We are dedicated to nurturing and pushing each of our team members to unleash the best version of their professional selves. We believe in a culture of trusted ownership, caring meritocracy, and constructive feedback where we elevate each other while constantly challenging the status quo. Join a dynamic, young company with an entrepreneurial culture operating at lightning speed — with eyes set on global horizons!

jd:
**Stellenbeschreibung**

Brennst Du für Frontend\\-Entwicklung? Dann hast Du jetzt die Möglichkeit Deine Leidenschaft bei Rueckwand24 zum Beruf zu machen. Wir suchen echte Enthusiasten, die mit Herzblut Großartiges entwickeln und beeindruckende Benutzeroberflächen erstellen. Fühlst Du Dich angesprochen?  
Dann ist DAS HIER Deine neue Stelle:

Als unser **Senior Frontend Entwickler** (m/w/d) spielst Du die entscheidende Rolle bei der Verwirklichung unserer visuellen Ideen. Du bist für die Konstruktion unserer UI\\-Elemente verantwortlich und sorgst dafür, dass diese pixelgenau auf unserer E\\-Commerce\\-Plattform Shopify umgesetzt werden. Dabei arbeitest Du eng mit unserem top\\-qualifizierten Team aus Designern und Entwicklern zusammen und übernimmst die Verantwortung für die Entwicklung von ansprechenden und benutzerfreundlichen E\\-Commerce\\-Websites. Du bleibst stets auf dem neuesten technologischen Stand und übernimmst Führungsverantwortung, um Webanwendungen für unseren E\\-Commerce\\-Shop zu entwickeln, zu implementieren und zu warten.

Klingt spannend? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!

**Senior Frontend Entwickler** (m/w/d)

**Vollzeit in Wiesbaden**

**Deine Vorteile bei Rueckwand24**

· Junges, multikulturelles und dynamisches Unternehmen mit großem Entwicklungspotenzial

· Äußerst freundliches und familiäres Miteinander sowie Freude an der Arbeit

· Freiräume plus Ruhe\\- und Sozialräume für Co\\-Working, konzentriertes Arbeiten

· Modernste Mitarbeiter\\-Kitchen \\& Living Area für Deine kreative Entfaltung

· Hoch\\-Modernes Büro mit erstklassiger technischer Ausstattung

· Förderung der persönlichen Entwicklung

· Mentoring sowie begleitendes Projekt\\-Onboarding

· Gute Bus\\-, Bahn\\- und Autobahnanbindung

· 1 Tag Arbeitsfrei bei besonderen Anlässen

· Faire Bezahlung mit Gehaltsoptimierung und betriebliche Altersvorsorge

· Frei benutzbares Handy \\+ Vertrag

· Kostenloser Zugang zu Premium Partner\\-Fitnessstudio

· Mentoring \\& Coaching Programme um Dein volles Potential zu realisieren

**Wer ist Rueckwand24?**

Jung. Anders. Dennoch sehr professionell. Wir stellen alles auf den Kopf und fragen uns ständig: Warum ist das sooo kompliziert? Warum ist das Design so hässlich? Warum, warum, warum…? Wir lieben Tech und geiles Marketing. Bei uns geht’s um Abenteuer und einzigartige Erlebnisse – sowohl für unsere Kunden als auch für uns selbst.

**Was macht Rueckwand24?**

Warum das Leben unnötig kompliziert für Kunden und Mitarbeiter machen, wenn alles mit nur einem Klick funktionieren kann? Rueckwand24 \\- dank visionären Ideen und innovativen Technologien ermöglichen wir es unseren Kunden Ihre vier Wände mit grenzenloser Kreativität selbst zu gestalten – ganz bequem online auf Knopfdruck und ohne handwerkliches Know\\-How. Als Marktführer in unserer Branche wachsen wir stetig weiter und setzen die neusten Trends \\- wie die direkte Implementierung von KI und intelligenter Automation in alle Geschäftsprozesse, ohne dass es Kunden und Mitarbeiter spüren – alles funktioniert einfach wie von Geisterhand. Am Ende setzen wir um, was zuvor als „geht nicht, das funktioniert so nicht“ deklariert wurde – mit nur einem Klick. Unser IT\\-Team denkt immer out\\-of\\-the\\-box und ist die ideale Spielwiese zur persönlichen und technologischen Entwicklung von jungen Talenten. Werde ein Teil der Marke, die als „disruptiv“, „die sind verrückt“, „die machen Geiles Marketing“ und „boah, wie haben die das gemacht“ wahrgenommen wird. In einem Umfeld junger und talentierter à Partner, die einfach, Lust und Freude daran haben mit größter Leidenschaft Vollgas zu geben.

Sei dabei und gestalte die Zukunft mit uns!

**Deine Aufgaben**

* Umsetzung moderner UI’s mittels CSS3, JS, JQuery, HTML 5, ReactJs, NodeJs
* Erstellung von Frontend\\-Anwendungen (Web applications)
* Sicherstellung der Qualität und Wartbarkeit des Codes mit Hilfe von Testing, Code Reviews und Pair Programming
* Entwicklung sauber dokumentierter, ausgiebig getesteter und mit modernen Browsern kompatibler Codes
* Selbstständige Identifizierung von Optimierungspotenzial und Verantwortung für eine optimale User Experience
* Umsetzung von Designs in Shopify Liquid, HTML, CSS und JavaScript
* Entwicklung von benutzerfreundlichen Funktionen und Schnittstellen
* Sicherstellung der Leistung und Kompatibilität der Website auf verschiedenen Geräten und Plattformen
* Realisierung qualitativ hochwertiger Frontend Entwicklung für unsere Plattform
* Mentoring für Junior Entwickler

**Dein Profil**

* Min. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Front\\-End\\-Entwicklung
* Liebe für genanntes Aufgabengebiet
* Gutes Verständnis für UI/ UX und Web Development
* gute Erfahrungen mit React JS oder vergleichbaren Frameworks
* Erfahrungen im Bereich User Experience und Responsive Design mit Tools wie Figma
* Zuverlässiges und termintreues Arbeitsverständnis
* Freundliche und professionelle Kommunikation
* Sprachkenntnisse: Flüssiges Deutsch oder Englisch
* Von Vorteil: Erfahrung im Umgang mit GitHub
* Von Vorteil: E\\-Commerce/Shopify Erfahrung

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Festanstellung

Arbeitszeiten:

* 8\\-Stunden\\-Schicht
* Keine Wochenenden
* Montag bis Freitag

Leistungen:

* Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
* Betriebliche Weiterbildung
* Essenszuschuss
* Firmenevents
* Firmenhandy
* Flexible Arbeitszeiten
* Kostenlose Getränke
* Mentoring\\-Programm für Mitarbeiter
* Preisnachlässe auf Produkte/Dienstleistungen des Unternehmens
* Zusätzliche Urlaubstage

Arbeitsort: Vor Ort

jd:
**About MotherDuck**
 Don’t let the quirky name fool you! We’re on a mission to radically transform the data analyst user experience. We empower and delight analysts using a novel cloud architecture built on top of DuckDB, an open source foundation with a vibrant community. Our team is a diverse mix of passionate, collaborative and empathetic data industry veterans from Google, Amazon, Meta, Snowflake, Looker, SingleStore, Databricks, and the like.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

 The UI engineers at MotherDuck build a best\\-in\\-class user experience for standard data warehouse operations and SQL querying. Our team has delivered features that users love, including the Column Explorer for visualizing distributions across any table or result set, and Instant SQL with real\\-time result previews. You'll contribute to this vision, working on everything from the data warehouse service layer to high\\-finesse features that simplify data analysis.
   

  

 As a member of the team, you’ll work closely with design, product, and our platform and databases teams to build intuitive, performant, and polished user experiences that help people go from data to insight without friction. You’ll also play a key role in defining the development culture and standards as we scale the team and the product.
   

  

 This is a hybrid role that can be based in our Seattle or San Francisco hubs.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Build delightful interfaces: Design and implement beautiful, performant, and accessible UIs that make working with data feel like magic.
* Own user experience: Work closely with designers and researchers to understand real\\-world user problems and ship features that meet them with empathy and creativity.
* Collaborate deeply: Partner with backend engineers, PMs, and fellow frontend developers to bring new experiences to life—across data exploration, visualization, collaboration, and more.
* Craft quality code: Write clean, reusable, and well\\-tested code. Help evolve our component library, design system, and development patterns.
* Prototype with speed: Rapidly explore new ideas through prototypes and experiments to validate assumptions and refine user workflows.
* Influence our direction: As an early hire, you’ll help shape not only the product, but our engineering culture, frontend architecture, and technical roadmap.


 What you bring
   

  

* Proven experience in software development, with a focus on frontend development.
* Proficiency with HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript, and experience with frameworks like React.
* Strong aesthetic and interaction instincts—both for end\\-user experience and internal component APIs.
* Experience collaborating in cross\\-functional teams with designers, PMs, and engineers.
* A generalist mindset—you’re comfortable navigating ambiguity, making decisions without perfect information, and working across the stack when needed.
* Experience working on developer tools, BI tools, notebooks, or data visualization products.
* Familiarity with the JavaScript/TypeScript tooling ecosystem (Vite, esbuild, etc.).
* Experience developing UI component libraries and sweating the details of animations, interactions, and pixel\\-perfect implementation
* Background working with SQL, data warehouses, or analytics platforms
* A passion for the craft of frontend—bringing joy, clarity, and power to users through great UX.


 What people should be saying if you’re doing ducking awesome
   

  

* “Every time I use the MotherDuck UI, I feel like someone actually thought about my workflow. It's snappy, intuitive, and even kinda fun?”
* “The people that made this UI really care about craft.”

* Unlimited PTO – take the time you need to recharge, explore, or just have a lazy day by the pond.
* 401k plan – because even ducks need to plan for the future.
* Legendary company events – we bring the whole flock together twice a year for unforgettable summits in fun locations, plus 1\\-2 team gatherings a year to keep our bonds strong.
* Hybrid work environment – Spend three days a week in the office collaborating with the flock, and work from wherever you’re most productive the rest of the time—whether that’s your home office, a coffee shop, or a peaceful lakeside retreat.


 Please Apply
   

  

 Does this role sound appealing to you, but you’re missing some of the requirements or don’t quite think you’re qualified? Please apply anyway. Join our dynamic team to shape the future of AI\\-driven hardware development! We’re seeking a talented Frontend Engineer to craft cutting\\-edge interfaces and tools for groundbreaking projects that transform how hardware emulation, simulations, and next\\-gen workflows are built.
   

  

 In this role, you will work closely with a dedicated team of talented engineers and researchers to develop robust and intuitive frontend solutions. The focus will be on building modern, responsive user interfaces and collaborating across teams to ensure seamless integration.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Lead frontend development: Build and modernize user interfaces for customer projects and the main product.
* Collaborate across teams: Partner with backend engineers to integrate APIs and ensure smooth communication between the frontend and backend.
* Set up modern tooling: Optimize the development pipeline with tools like npm or webpack.
* Deliver high\\-quality code: Ensure robustness and maintainability.


**Required Qualifications**
* 
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
* 
* Proficiency in modern JavaScript (ES6\\+) and modern frameworks (including the Fetch API).
*

*

* Preferred Qualifications:
* 
* Familiarity with Node.js for backend integration.
* 
* Experience building or contributing to plugins (e.g., for VS Code or similar environments).
* 
* Experience developing IDEs.


**Preferred Qualifications**

* Flexible hybrid work arrangement.
* Relocation assistance for qualifying employees.

jd:
**About Sprig**
 Sprig is empowering the fastest\\-growing and largest companies to build digital products for people, not just data points. Our platform enables product teams to ask any question about their product, observe user interactions, and receive actionable product recommendations to drive success. Today, we’re proud to partner with industry leaders like Notion, Figma, Ramp, Robinhood, Coinbase, and TripAdvisor, helping them build world\\-class products.
   

  

 As we continue our journey towards $100M in revenue and beyond, Sprig’s vision is to shape the future of autonomous product development, where products evolve and self\\-iterate in real\\-time. By automatically analyzing user experiences as they happen, Sprig AI will synthesize data and identify product improvements instantly, ensuring nearly flawless user experiences and driving the next wave of innovation in product management.
   

  

 As part of a new AI agent ecosystem, Sprig will collaborate with generative design and coding platforms to create a future where product teams will guide AI platforms in continuously adapting and improving products.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about redefining how products are built and want to be part of a team that’s leading the future of autonomous product development, we’d love to have you join us. Learn more about our mission, values, and how you can be part of this exciting journey here.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Sprig is on a path to build world\\-class product experience platform that empowers the best businesses to truly understand how their users experience their product at\\-scale. The goal of the Core team at Sprig is to build and deploy high performant and minimal footprint SDKs and develop the dashboard experience to manage these studies. Our Frontend engineers are responsible for the development and deployment of our SDK and React dashboard. Your work will be used by millions of people throughout the world so ensuring stability, resiliency and performance of our software is critical.
   

  

 This role is based in San Francisco with three days working in office.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* You'll be working as part of our highly experienced engineering team and jump in at the beginning to develop a world\\-class product
* Own the development and deployment of our public available SDKs used by millions of users
* Architect and build our React dashboard, ensuring readability and DRY\\-principles are adhered to
* Collaborate with leadership to develop our engineering and product roadmap
* Stay informed with industry best practices and provide guidance, inspiration, and mentorship in engineering excellence for cross\\-functional colleagues


**Your Strengths**
* Extensive experience with Typescript \\+ React, Node.js
* Expert in optimizing page load performance
* Deep understanding of modern web practices and the relevant technologies
* Passion for learning, building, and moving fast. With an ambitious plan for the next 12 months, we highly value your ability and appetite for learning
* Proactively identify opportunities to improve our web platform
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document and explain the technical work that has been done


**Benefits \\& Perks**
* Competitive Salary
* Competitive Employee Equity
* 401K Program
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
* FSA/HSA Benefit
* $175/month Commuter Benefit
* Additional Wellbeing Benefits
* Flexible Paid Time Off
* Paid Parental Leave
* Professional Development Stipend
* Hybrid Office Policy
* Lunch available 5x a week in SF
* Dinner available 4x a week in SF
* Company Sponsored Social Events


 At Sprig, we pride ourselves on being a people\\-first company, where your contributions truly matter and are valued. We were recently awarded by Fortune as top 50 best places to work in the US, and top 50 Places to Work in the Bay Area by Built In. Come join our mission of building products users love and have a real impact on Sprig’s future.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 We prioritize diversity within our team and value different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.
   

  

**Employee Pay Disclosure**
 The salary range for this full\\-time position is $200,000 \\- $250,000 \\+ Equity \\+ Benefits. Our cash compensation ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for San Francisco, CA. Within the range, individual pay is determined by additional factors, including job\\-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Please note that the compensation details listed in postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include equity or benefits.
   

  

 \\*\\*\\*Please beware of scammers who are posing as Sprig and Sprig team members. Our recruiters use @sprig.com email addresses exclusively. We do not conduct interviews via text or instant message, and we do not ask candidates to purchase equipment through us or solicit money from you. If you have been contacted by someone claiming to be from a different domain about a job offer, please report it as potential job fraud to law enforcement and contact us here.\\*\\*\\*

jd:
*Evac has been a pioneer in sustainable technologies and solutions for decades. Today we are the world’s leading provider of integrated Evac® water, waste and wastewater technologies, Cathelco® corrosion protection and marine growth prevention and HEM® freshwater systems.*

As a **Field Service Engineer** in our Onboard Service team, you’ll be on the front lines of technical support and service delivery—globally. Whether it’s commissioning new systems, performing advanced troubleshooting, training field teams, or delivering critical maintenance and repair services, you’ll be instrumental in supporting Evac’s mission across sailing vessels, shipyards, and customer sites worldwide.

You’ll bring deep expertise in at least one Evac product range and general competency across multiple systems. You’ll also be a key contact for internal stakeholders, offering expert\\-level technical advice and hands\\-on support to ensure customer satisfaction and optimal system performance.

**What You’ll Do**

**Onboard Service Tasks**

* Carry out preventive maintenance, repair, commissioning, warranty, and project work on customer sites
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues with installations and product performance
* Perform start\\-ups, product testing, and hands\\-on customer training
* Deliver field training for new Service Technicians and Engineers
* Supervise projects onsite and coordinate with Project Managers

**Project \\& Product Support**

* Provide expert field feedback to Product Management and R\\&D teams
* Support warranty and pre\\-sales surveys, including courtesy visits and system reviews
* Assist with technical support inquiries from internal teams
* Contribute to equipment testing during development phases

**Customer Satisfaction \\& Sustainability**

* Maintain professional, solution\\-focused communication with customers
* Write detailed reports to support service, quality improvements, and technical documentation
* Help improve products and services through lessons learned in the field

**Our Requirements**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or relevant vocational qualification
* Strong **mechanical and electrical technical skills**
* Experience reading and interpreting technical drawings, blueprints, and P\\&IDs
* Good working knowledge of MS Word and Excel
* Solid written and spoken English communication skills
* Knowledge of control software (basic level)
* High attention to detail and report writing skills
* Ability to work under pressure, independently or in a team
* Flexibility for **global travel up to 180 days per year**
* Valid **driver’s licence (B)**
* Suitable physical ability for work on board vessels and at shipyards

**Join Us. Travel the world. Power the shift to sustainable marine solutions.**

Ready to take your engineering expertise global? Apply now and become part of a passionate team driving change in the maritime industry.

Job Types: Full\\-time, Permanent

Pay: 4\\.500,00€ per month

Work Location: Remote

jd:
**About the Role:** We are seeking a Process Engineer (f/m/d) to join our engineering team. In this role, you will collaborate with external suppliers for product transitions and commercial production as needed. Additionally, you will support the development of new products and lead scale\\-up activities.

  



This position will be located at our facility in Putzbrunn, near Munich, with the possibility of a hybrid remote work arrangement, depending upon the responsibilities of the role and business needs.

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Validate new raw materials and changes in raw materials to ensure all product requirements for our Filtration and Electronics businesses are met
* Asses technical capabilities of CM (Contract Manufacturers) and participate in CM selection decisions. Support CM in developing new capability/capacity to fulfill future business needs
* Take ownership of product transfer to CM and partner with CM on technical issues related to our products
* Along with R\\&D team, act as a technical liaison to support product development e.g., accompany and assess sample manufacturing runs
* Transition products from sample/non\\-commercial manufacturing to full\\-scale commercial production
* Establish testing capabilities at CMs and support test method validation
* Monitor and improve product performance (stability/capability of product attributes, yield, etc.) of commercial products utilizing statistical methods and other tools
* Define, execute and document engineering projects including process development and scale\\-up, product/process validation, capacity and improvement efforts
* Collaborate with international business and process engineering teams to successfully establish global supply chains that meet our customers' requirements

 **Required Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, Materials or equivalent)
* Minimum 3 years of direct hands\\-on experience in a manufacturing environment as a Process Engineer
* Proven experience working with R\\&D teams
* Fundamental knowledge of statistical tools for development, optimization, and troubleshooting activities
* Project Management Skills
* Illustrated success in scaling up processes
* Systematic and analytic approach to problem\\-solving
* Effective written and oral communication including English proficiency in technical discussions
* Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively as part of a team, including influencing across functions
* Fluent in German and English

  


**Desired Qualifications:**


* Experience with industrial fabric manufacturing – nonwoven processing, weaving, texturizing, coating, finishing, heat setting, sewing
* Membrane manufacturing experience and successful experience managing complex projects with external partners in global environments
* Advanced statistical skills and experience, e.g. Design of Experiments (DoE), Statistical process Control (SPC) etc.

  



Hybrid Working Arrangements are permitted with appropriate approval and compliance with Gore’s policy.

  


**What We Offer:** Our success is based on the capability and creativity of our Associates, and we are proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive total rewards program that supports your everyday and helps you build your tomorrow.

  



We provide benefits that offer choice and flexibility and promote overall well\\-being. And in keeping with our belief that every Associate should share in the collective success of the enterprise; we provide a distinctive Associate Stock Ownership Plan in each country as well as potential opportunities for “profit\\-sharing”. Learn more at gore.com/careers/benefits

  



We believe in the strength of a diverse and inclusive workplace. With diverse perspectives, ideas and experiences, we uncover new possibilities and make a greater impact in the world. We are proud of Associates for building on our rich history of innovation, upholding our values and supporting an inclusive work environment where we treat each other and our external partners with fairness, dignity and respect.

  



Gore is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome all applications irrespective of race, color, religion, sex, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, status as a qualified individual with a disability, genetic information, pregnancy status, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran, gender identity and expression, and any other characteristic protected by applicable laws and regulations.

  



Our Talent Acquisition Team welcomes your questions at gore.com/careers/contact

  


**\\#LI\\-ASC**

============================

STELLEN ID: 9776
STANDORT:
Hamburg, DE, 22419
FACHBEREICH: Service
**YOUR TASKS**


* Representing Service in strategic development projects (PEP) and supporting the market launch from a Service perspective
* Early identification of technical problems on prototypes/pre\\-series turbines and their processing in interdisciplinary teams
* Preparation and documentation of findings from the market launch
* Participation in regular expert groups and presentation of work results
* Developing solutions for series problems (together with development engineering)
* Preparation and implementation of technical workshops with local service organizations
* On\\- and offsite support of the local service organization as part of the market launch

  




**YOUR PROFIL**


* Many years of professional experience in the wind energy industry combined with extensive technical knowledge of wind turbines
* Experience as Master Technician, Supervisor or Commissioner (mechanical or electrical)
* Meticulous and systematic approach to work and problem solving skills
* Good knowledge of the English language, Spanish an advantage
* Good knowledge of MS Office applications
* Strong teamwork and communication skills
* Ability to work at heights and willingness to occasionally travel internationally


**IHRE BENEFITS**


Bei Nordex bieten wir Ihnen zusätzlich zur Chance unsere Welt ein Stück nachhaltiger zu gestalten:

  


* *Einige Angebote können je nach Standort variieren*


*Nordex verfolgt eine Politik gleichberechtigter Jobchancen. Alle Entscheidungen im Bewerbungsprozess werden unabhängig von Religion, Alter, Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, Nationalität oder Behinderungen und in voller Übereinstimmung mit allen gültigen Gesetzen getroffen.*


*Schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerbende werden bei gleicher Eignung besonders berücksichtigt.*  

  

Eine Beschäftigung ist grundsätzlich auch in Teilzeit möglich.


**DIE NORDEX GROUP**
--------------------


Die Herstellung von Windenergieanlagen im On\\-Shore\\-Segment ist seit 40 Jahren unsere Kernkompetenz und Leidenschaft. Mit mehr als 57 GW installierter Kapazität weltweit, liefern unsere Anlagen nachhaltige Energie in mehr als 80% des globalen Energiemarktes und wir zählen zu den größten Unternehmen in der Windindustrie. Ländergesellschaften in mehr als 40 Märkten und Produktionsstätten in Deutschland, Spanien, Brasilien, den USA, Mexiko und Indien bieten unseren über 10,400 Mitarbeitenden die Möglichkeit zur internationalen und interkulturellen Zusammenarbeit.  

  

Wir wachsen und treiben den Ausbau alternativer Energien weltweit gemeinsam voran – wenn Sie wollen, ab jetzt mit Ihnen. Werden Sie Teil des \\#TeamNordex!


**Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung! Um es Ihnen leichter zu machen, verzichten wir gern auf ein Anschreiben.**
