Position nameProject Manager


4\\.1 Role


Responsible for leading and managing the company's crane product development projects in the European region, ensuring timely delivery, budget compliance, and meeting product specifications and quality standards. This position requires collaboration with cross\\-functional teams, including engineering, design, manufacturing, quality control, etc., to achieve product development goals and drive innovation.


4\\.2 Responsibilities


* Develop European crane product R\\&D project plans and schedules to ensure project objectives and delivery timelines are achieved.


* Manage project teams, including engineers, designers, and technical personnel, guiding them to complete various tasks and project phases.
* Track project progress and budgets, promptly identifying and resolving issues and challenges that may affect project progress.
* Coordinate communication and collaboration among project stakeholders, including internal teams, European regional branches, suppliers, and partners, to ensure smooth project execution.
* Ensure that the project complies with company quality standards and regulatory requirements, overseeing product design, testing, and validation processes.
* Review and evaluate project progress, reporting project status and risks to management and stakeholders.
* Ensure project compliance with relevant regulations and standards, including safety, environmental, and intellectual property requirements.
* Participate in defining product specifications and functionalities, proposing technical recommendations and innovative solutions to meet the needs of the European market.
* Continuously monitor industry trends and technological innovations, providing the company with product development direction and strategic recommendations.


4\\.3 Requirements


* in Engineering or related fields, with a preference for Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Engineering Management backgrounds.
* Extensive work experience in the crane industry or related fields, with a preference for candidates with experience in product development or project management.
* Strong project management skills, including planning, organizing, leading, supervising, and controlling.
* Excellent communication and coordination abilities, capable of effective collaboration with cross\\-functional teams and communication with teams in the European region.
* Innovative thinking and problem\\-solving skills, able to assess product requirements from both technical and market perspectives and propose corresponding solutions.
* Familiarity with product development processes and engineering design software such as CAD, SolidWorks, etc. Fluent in spoken and written English, with proficiency in other European languages being advantageous.

jd:
**About Ingredion:**


Join Ingredion, where innovation impacts lives worldwide! Without even realizing it, you’ve experienced our work in your favorite chocolate, your pet’s food, the paper you write on, and your everyday snacks. As a global powerhouse across more than 60 industries, we harness the potential of natural ingredients to transform lives. Whether you’re just starting your career or bringing years of experience, there's a place for you here to make a real difference. Be part of our team that values a wide range of perspectives and is committed to shaping a better world with every product we create.

**Senior Project Engineer Europe (m/f/d)**

**LOCATION: Hamburg, Germany**

**REPORTS TO: Sr. Manager Engineering and Reliability Europe**

**DIRECT REPORTS: None – Project team members as indirect reports**

The **Sr. Project Engineer Europe** is responsible for planning, coordination, and management of investment projects in coordination with the needs of the business partners as well as ensuring efficient, time, resource\\-, and cost\\-effective execution.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* Development of (new) technical concepts and transfer into concrete projects along with risk management
* End\\-to\\-end project management: from concept design to planning, implementation, commissioning and handover to the future owner/user
* Technical and commercial project management, including \\-
	+ Preparation of specifications and requests for quotations for key components and services
	+ Budget management: budget estimation, cost tracking, reporting
	+ Technical review of offers and order confirmations and its justification
	+ Documentation management
* Continuous project control with responsibility for adherence to scope, budget, schedule, health and safety as well as quality objectives
* Manage internal \\& external stakeholders, including suppliers and contractors
* Close collaboration with other departments such as Operations, Process Engineering, Maintenance, EHS, Quality…
* Independent identification of optimization opportunities and implementation of improvement projects, e.g. in the areas of operational efficiency, quality, EHS
* Participation in plant on\\-call duty (Werksrufbereitschaft)

 **Qualified candidates will have:**


Mandatory requirements:

* Master of Science or similar degree in Process Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or similar
* Experience in Project Management, Process Engineering, ideally in a manufacturing and maintenance environment

Fluent in Spoken \\& Written English and min. B2 in German  
* 

Desirable Requirements

* Desirable 5 to 10 years of professional experience in Project Management
* MS Office, MS Project, SAP

  

Required behaviors and skills

* Good communication skills
* Team player with ability to build teams and manage personnel
* Willingness to travel across various Ingredion sites, as part of projects
* Autonomous, analytical, structured way of working (end\\-to\\-end)
* Strategic mindset and proactive, results oriented working approach
* Ideally, willingness to grow personally within the global organization

**Relocation Available:**


No

jd:
### **Hi there! Thanks for stopping by**



Are you passionate about tackling climate change? Eager to make a real impact on the environment? Well, look no further \\- you're in the perfect place!



We are seeking a passionate advocate for climate action to join our diverse team in building and testing our electric heater, designed to fully replace fossil fuel flames. As a working student or intern focused on simulation tasks, you will develop simulation models, run parametric simulations, and post\\-process and report the results. You'll use the built\\-in FEM and CFD modules in Ansys Mechanical and Fluent/CFX. You can work from our headquarters in Offenburg or remotely, depending on the nature of the work and project requirements.


### **Responsibilities**


* Understand concepts developed by the engineering team and create simplified thermal and mechanical models in a simulation environment.
* Support concept development with curiosity, creativity, and experience.
* Collaborate with colleagues to define and discuss boundary and initial conditions for the simulation models.
* Develop simulation models using appropriate physics and simplifications that reflect real\\-world scenarios.
* Critically evaluate simulation results and present them in a clear, digestible format for the team.
* Explore new approaches, research existing knowledge, and engage in team discussions to improve processes.
* Iterate and refine simulation models based on feedback from the engineering team until they meet the specified requirements.

### **What you'll bring to the team:**


* Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree program in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
* Available to work as a working student or intern, either full\\-time or part\\-time.
* Some experience with CFD and/or FEM simulation models.
* Strong research and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple small projects simultaneously.
* Experience in thermal model development is a plus.


**While remote work may be possible during the first two weeks to allow time for relocation, we expect the student to work from the office at least three days per week thereafter.**



We understand that there's more to a person than what's on their CV. If you're unsure whether you have the right profile for the role… go ahead and hit the 'Apply' button and give it a try!


### **What's in it for you?**


**Working at HyperHeat**


* We're a climate tech startup. You'll join us in our mission to fight climate change and make a real difference!
* You'll learn all about our company, our story, our team, and our workflow, and you will receive comprehensive practical onboarding.
* We're a small, close\\-knit crew that values teamwork, open chats, and a flat structure. You'll work closely directly with the founders.
* We're all about growth and learning, so we keep feedback positive and helpful.
* The team is led by supportive and approachable managers who recognize and reward your work.
* You'll be part of a team that likes to work together, help each other, share insights and achieve success.
* We value everyone's voice, with scheduled 1:1 and team calls to keep things running smoothly.
* We speak English here, so everyone's on the same page and can communicate smoothly.


**And some benefits to keep you happy:**


* Opportunity for rapid professional growth and hands\\-on experience in a climate startup environment.
* Flexible working hours and remote work options tailored to your lifestyle.
* 30 days of annual leave for optimal, well\\-charged batteries.
* Annual Christmas dinner hosted by the founders.
* Laptop and accessories provided based on your preferences.
* Regular team\\-building activities.
* Access to a mental health support program.

### **Who we are:**


**Hyperheat** is a young Climate Tech start\\-up with experienced founders and the goal of developing a renewable heat solution for energy\\-intensive industries. Basic industrial products, such as steel, cement, chemicals, glass, and paper, form the material basis of modern societies. However, the heat demand for their production is responsible for around 20% of human CO2 emissions (or 7,5 Gt CO2 each year) due to burning fossil fuels — therefore, it is one of the last major sectors without attractive, sustainable decarbonization solutions yet.



Hyperheat's products will provide a complete temperature range of up to 2000°C, making it a replacement for almost every gas burner in the industry. **Our solution will be more cost\\-effective than the fossil state of the art, contributing to a new basis for global prosperity.** At the heart of the development is a durable and cost\\-effective electric heater that can provide industrial process heat 24/7 from PV and wind power when combined with thermal storage.


### **Hiring Process**



Our hiring process is entirely remote, conducted via email and video chat for seamless communication.


* Initial 1:1 screening call with a hiring manager.
* Completion of a relevant take\\-home task to simulate actual work.
* Skill \\& Team interview with prospective team members.


At HyperHeat, we care deeply about inclusive working practices and diverse teams, so we particularly encourage applications from different under\\-represented demographics. If you'd prefer to work part\\-time or as a job\\-share, we'll facilitate this wherever we can – whether to help you meet other commitments or to help you strike a great work\\-life balance. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description.

**HRT Service Sales Engineer**
==============================


GEA is one of the largest suppliers for the food and beverage processing industry and a wide range of other process industries. Approximately 18,000 employees in more than 60 countries contribute significantly to GEA’s success – come and join them! We offer interesting and challenging tasks, a positive working environment in international teams and opportunities for personal development and growth in a global company.



Why join GEA

**Job information**

**Reference Number**
JR\\-0033226

**Job function**
Service

**Position type**
Full time

**Site**
N/A, N/A N/A


GEA is one of the world’s largest systems suppliers for the food, beverage and pharmaceutical sectors. Our portfolio includes machinery and plants as well as advanced process technology, components and comprehensive services. Used across diverse industries, they enhance the sustainability and efficiency of production processes globally. Would you like to be part of our Team? Join our Heating \\& Refrigeration Technologies Team in Mexico and support us as an HRT Service Sales Engineer.
Your responsibilities and tasks:* Develop the service sales strategy and ensure a CREATE\\-GEA approach to customers within the country (cooperation with Head of Service)
* Identifying opportunities for service sales
* Actively managing key customer accounts
* Operate in partnership with equipment of New Machines sales engineers to identify “up\\-sell” and “cross\\-sell” opportunities to maximize revenue and improve overall customer experience.
* Manage individual day to day activities with possible responsibility for multiple product groups / application clusters to ensure consistent approach and optimized performance
* Continuous optimization of processes and structure (strategy, methods, tools, personnel development, etc.) and related key figures.
* Find new ways to improve customer satisfaction
* Work with country Head of Service and Head of Sales to fine\\-tune service sales strategy
* Coordinate development of service sales strategy within Cluster
* Lead service sales activities within defined product group or application cluster, allocate resources and prioritize initiatives (Heating and Refrigeration)
* In collaboration with country head of service, agree on annual service sales budget.
* Coordinate service sales planning, forecasting and reporting
* Ensure employee engagement by effectively communicating service sales strategy and vision
* Work together with country heads of sales to ensure coordinated sales approach.

Your profile and qualifications:


The Service Sales Engineer is responsible for developing, promoting and selling the complete range of GEA service, specially of HRT (Heating \\& Refrigeration Technologies) division within the assigned product group or application cluster in the country.


* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in an engineering discipline (electronic, mechanical, etc.)
* Required languages: English
* Excellent communicator, written and verbal, able to work with individuals (internal and external) across a wide range of levels, functions, brands and cultures
* Prioritizes customer needs, establishes effective relationships with customers as well as internal stakeholders
* The ability to exert influence on his / her customers by conviction, persuasion and negotiation
* Can implement delegated tasks effectively, whilst maintaining involvement and responsibility for outcomes.
* The ability to gain high levels of trust from customers and to predict customer and competitor actions.
* Familiarity with GEA service offerings and local market requirements of different customer groups
* Negotiation skills


What will you find being part of GEA?

* Exciting professional challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a global operating environment.
* A work culture that promotes the spirit of innovation where our engineers create, develop and implement world\\-class solutions.
* We believe in delivering a true work experience in an equal opportunity environment that values difference and diversity.
* Market competitive salary and benefits complemented by flexible and autonomous work arrangements.

**What we offer:**
==================

* Benefits eines internationalen MDax\\-Konzerns (KION Group)
* Viel Gestaltungsspielraum in einem stark wachsenden Unternehmen
* Flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten
* Individuelle Unterstützung und Förderung
* Mitarbeiterrabatte

**Tasks and Qualifications:**
=============================

Die Kernaufgabe des EMEA\\-Teams Case Conveyor Systems ist die Realisierung von projektspezifischen Förderanlagen in der Intralogistik. Der Fokus ist die Behälter und leichte Stückgut Fördertechnik. Zur Anwendung kommt Dematic Standard Gurt\\- und Rollenfördertechnik, Fördertechnik Sonderkonstruktionen und Zukaufkomponenten. Das Spektrum der Zukaufkomponenten erstreckt sich von der Standardkatalogware bis zu komplexen Maschinen. Eine Bereichsübergreifende Kooperation mit den Fachbereichen Project Delivery, Hardware Controls, Structural Engineering, Software Controls, Solution Development, technischer Einkauf, CE Compliance, Fertigung und der Installation runden den Aufgabenbereich ab. Der Projektumfang und die Terminsituation entscheidet über die Anzahl der Teammitglieder, die in einem Projekt involviert sind. Aufgrund der unterschiedlichen Engineering Standorte die Dematic in EMEA besitzt, ist die Zusammensetzung des Projektteams mit Kollegen aus unterschiedlichen Nationen kein Einzelfall.


**Basic Engineering:**

* Maßaufnahme beim Kunden (Greenfield/ Brownfield Projekte)
* Erstellen des Genehmigungslayouts für das Customer Design Freeze
* Sicherheitsbetrachtung des Projektumfangs (Mechanik) und festlegen der erforderlichen Maßnahmen.
* Detailkonzepte basierend auf dem Sales\\- Layout und den Projektanforderungen erstellen und in das Genehmigungslayout integrieren
* Materialflussreview auf Basis des Sales\\- Layout und der Produkte die auf der Fördertechnik transportiert werden.
* Schnittstellenklärung zu anderen Gewerken wie Stahlbau, Gebäude, usw.
* Machbarkeitsprüfung des Layouts / Materialflusses gemeinsam mit Software / Hardware Controls
* Kollisionsprüfung
* Zugangsbereiche für den Service und Wartung der Anlage definieren.
* Flucht\\- und Transportwege festlegen
* Definition der erforderlichen Sonderkonstruktionen.
* Ergonomie Bewertung der Arbeitsplätze
* Vorläufiges Mockup\\- Design der Arbeitsplätze
* Engineering Support in Kundenmeetings während dieser Engineering Phase

**Detail Engineering:**

* Detail\\- Layout erstellen
* Detaildefinition der Fördertechnik (Antriebe, Fördergeschwindigkeiten, Rolle\\- und Gurtausführung, Seitenführung, Stützen, Abhängung, usw.)
* Detailplanung der erforderlichen Überstiege, Wartungsplattformen, etc. für Wartung und Service.
* Detailabstimmung der Layoutbereiche mit Software / Hardware Controls
* Detailplanung der erforderlichen Sicherheitseinrichtungen.
* Technische Spezifikationen für Zukaufkomponenten erstellen und mit dem Lieferanten die technischen Details abstimmen.
* Sonderkonstruktionen durchführen
* Finales Mockup\\- Design der Arbeitsplätze inkl. technische und ergonomische Detailabstimmung mit dem Kunden.
* Stücklisten für die Bestellung der Dematic Fördertechnik in unserer Fertigung erzeugen.
* Bestellanforderungen für Zukaufkomponenten in SAP generieren
* Datenlisten für die Hardware Controls Planung erstellen
* Installationszeichnungen erstellen
* Handover aller Informationen an das Installationsteam.
* Anlagen\\- Risikobeurteilung erstellen und gemeinsam mit CE\\- Compliance die Sicherheitsbegehung beim Kunden durchführen.
* Installations Support remote und direkt beim Kunden
* Engineering Support bei Lieferanten FAT
* Engineering Support in Kundenmeetings während dieser Engineering Phase
* Management von Arbeitspaketen innerhalb des Projektteams, auch von externem Engineering Support.

**Anforderungsprofil:**

* Diplom Ingenieur / Master\\- oder Bachelorabschluss Maschinenbau (eine Vertiefung in den Bereichen Fördertechnik oder Intralogistik wäre von Vorteil)
* 3 – 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung (Studienabsolventen geben wir gerne auch eine Chance)
* Kompetenz im Project Engineering (idealerweise im Bereich Intralogistik oder ähnlich)
* Kompetenz in der Maschinenkonstruktion (idealerweise im Bereich Fördertechnik oder ähnlich)
* Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
* Teamfähigkeit
* Kommunikationskompetenz
* Strukturierte und systematische Arbeitsweise
* Ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise
* Problemlösungskompetenz
* Selbstmanagementkompetenz
* AutoCAD Kenntnisse
* NX \\+ Teamcenter Kenntnisse
* Navisworks Kenntnisse
* SAP\\-Kenntnisse
* Reisebereitschaft

The position can be filled in full or part time.
Summary
We are looking for an "Industrial Mechanic / Mechatronics Technician (f/m/d)" for the "Handheld Optronics" unit at the Wetzlar site as soon as possible.  

  

The Wetzlar site develops and manufactures rifle scopes, target optics and optronic equipment such as residual light and thermal imaging clip\\-on systems as well as fire control systems for handheld weapons, but also unstabilized periscopes for armored vehicles and calibration technology for artillery.
Your Tasks* Pre\\- and final assembly of (mechanical) assemblies and devices
* Cleaning, assembly, bonding and adjustment of optics
* Soldering of components
* Disassembly of repair equipment and repair of assemblies and devices
* Carrying out final inspections and quality assurance
* Selection of measuring and testing equipment for intermediate and final testing
* Completion of test reports
* Collaboration in the continuous improvement process


Your Profile* Completed vocational training as an industrial mechanic or similar
* Experience in the assembly of optical and/or mechanical devices advantageous
* Professional experience in an assembly company advantageous
* Knowledge of soldering and bonding
* Good basic PC skills (SAP and Excel)
* Ability to work independently and in a team
* High willingness to learn and flexibility
* Very good knowledge of German


Happy to hear* Work on extraordinary high\\-tech products at the limits of physics
* Fair, performance\\-related remuneration, plus special payments
* Flexible working time and workplace models
* Company pension scheme
* Individual development and training opportunities
* Family\\-friendly working conditions and meal \\& snack options
* Health promotion and mobility offers


Discover more about our benefits "HERE".
You want to become part of a future\\-oriented company? Are you ready to assume responsibility in exciting international and national projects? Then you YOU are our candidate (f/m/d)!
Please apply exclusively online via our career portal with your CV and certificates.
We aim to streamline our application process as much as possible and therefore do not require a cover letter.
Be the pioneer of our future!  

We look forward to receiving your application!
In case you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact our Talent Resourcing Team:  

E\\-Mail: jobs@hensoldt.net  


HENSOLDT is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

\\- Knowledge of key electrical competencies and theory
\\- High school or equivalent diploma
  

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
We are looking for a Data Center Engineering Operations Technician to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. Data Center Engineering Operations Technician is a hands\\-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operation responder. If you like to use apply your electrical and mechanical skills to solve problems, we’d like to meet you. Your work will help to maintain one of the world's largest information system infrastructures.
Key job responsibilities
• SAFETY
Follow and maintain the highest safety standards and diligently encourage a world\\-class safety culture. As a facility owner team, ensure remediation of safety risks/issues in conjunction with other teams. Own the safety initiatives and projects to foster strong safety culture.
• ENGINEERING \\& FACILITY OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE
Operational experience and familiarity with electrical and mechanical equipment, including Uninterruptable Power Supplies (UPS’s), Switchgear, Circuit Breakers, Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS's), Diesel Generators, Chillers, Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC), Exhaust Fans, Variable Frequency Drives (VFD's), and Transformers.
o Troubleshoot events within internal Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
o Take daily operational readings of all mechanical and electrical equipment through routine rounds/log\\-taking (temperatures, voltages, currents, etc.)
o Supervise contractors who perform servicing or preventive maintenance
Physical requirements
• Manual handling and lifting of equipment may be required (weight limits in accordance with regulations).
• Ability to work shifts (morning, late and night)
• On\\-call rotation reaction to off\\-duty emergency calls
• Work at heights and from ladders; in a noisy environment with ear protection
• Perform physical tasks during the shift
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship \\& Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\\-sharing, mentorship and other career\\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\\-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work\\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

* Experience in data center engineering
* Knowledge of mechanical systems (Mechanical, HVAC systems, Controls)

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

m/w/d  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\\-we\\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

**Job Description**
-------------------


Are you looking for a patient\\-oriented, innovation\\-driven company that inspires you and promotes your career? Then take your future in your hands and become part of Takeda as a

**Automation Engineer MES (f/m/d)**

  

In this role you are responsible for the development and implementation of a wide range of automation concepts and technologies in a pharma manufacturing plant.

**How you will contribute:**

* Collaborate with the local and global TAKEDA teams and our technology partners to drive the development of applications in a wide range of technologies: Scada systems, Historians, MES (Werum PAS\\-X) and pharmaceutical production equipment
* Provide technical expertise, problem\\-solving skills and project managemen capabilities for automation projects
* Analyze and solve complex automation and \\-interface problems together with partners from IT.
* Lead and support development of requirement analysis and build End\\-to\\-End use cases
* Ensure technical availability of automation systems
* Work as automation lead in investment projects


You will report to the Head of Automation Engineering.

**What you bring to Takeda:**

* University or technical college degree ,diploma or master, in industrial engineering, mechanical engineering, automation technology or similar
* Several years of relevant engineering experience in automation engineering with MES integration focus
* Project management skills and strong interpersonal and communication skills written and verbal
* A basic understanding of working in a (GMP) regulated environment.

**What we offer you:**

* Attractive and competitive salary
* Open\\-minded and modern working environment
* 30 vacation days
* Company pension plan
* Further education and training
* Attractive Relocation Package including brokerage fees
* Subsidized canteen
* Subsidized health and sports programs
* Disability insurance
* Long\\-term account
* Employee discounts
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Company accident insurance
* Performance\\-related bonus
* Trust working hours
* Employee Referral Program
* Deferred compensation as desired
* Global Wellbeing Program
* Parent Child Office
* Employee Recognition Program

**About Us:**


Takeda is focused on creating better health for people and a brighter future for the world. We aim to discover and deliver life\\-transforming treatments in our core therapeutic and business areas, including gastrointestinal and inflammation, rare diseases, plasma\\-derived therapies, oncology, neuroscience and vaccines.  

  

The Oranienburg manufacturing site in the Berlin\\-Brandenburg metropolitan region is the Takeda site with the most employees for the production of solid dosage forms (capsules and tablets). The site also houses a pilot production facility for clinical development projects. Pharmaceutical manufacturing in Oranienburg can look back on a tradition of more than 135 years. Takeda Oranienburg is a regionally significant employer and has been awarded the independent Top Employer certificate several years in a row. **Job Description Summary**
===========================


Become part of a winning team and help to deliver the Green Energy transition.  

  

As a Lead Cooling System Engineer you will report to the Valve Cooling Team Leader within the HVDC Valves Engineering Department.  

  

As the successful candidate, you will be part of a highly motivated, dynamic and rapidly growing team of engineers working on the development of cooling systems for new power electronics applications for HVDC converters and the forthcoming HVDC Grid.  

  

The Cooling System Engineer role covers the mechanical, instrumentation, and control design of the pure\\-water cooling systems for HVDC converter valves.  

  

This role gives an excellent opportunity for a motivated candidate to innovate, expand their design skill and personal development within an internationally recognised expert in this exciting field.**Job Description**
===================


Responsibilities:

* Perform technical evaluation of HVDC cooling systems supplier’s proposals and documentation.
* Pure\\-water cooling system scheme design for HVDC \\& FACTs.
* P\\&ID and Flow diagram preparation.
* cooling plant 3D models review and approval.
* Review of mechanical drawings which includes pump unit general arrangement, treatment unit general arrangement, cooling room layout, coolers layout, pipe routing, civil guide drawings, and support structure guide drawings.
* Preliminary equipment sizing using calculation tools.
* Review of installation drawings.
* Equipment sizing, specification, calculation and approval.
* Instrumentation specification and approval.
* Review of spare part list, special tool list, commissioning spare part list for pure\\-water cooling systems.
* Review of operation and maintenance manual.
* Pure\\-water cooling system testing supervision, revision and approval.
* Pure\\-water cooling system installation supervision.
* Pure\\-water cooling system commissioning.
* Perform RAM studies.
* Compile DFMEA and design document and know how to apply PFMEA.
* Decisive in addressing technical hurdles and maintaining performance.
* Review and approve the drawings and design documentation when required.
* Ability to undertake deep technical reviews of technology with engineering experts.
* Innovation on new technical ideas for patent applications.
* Work closely with sourcing and procurement for cooling system suppliers selection.
* Integration with other departments (engineering, manufacturing, S\\&P, SQA) for product development and support tendering and project delivery.
* Actively broadening and deepening HVDC cooling system knowledge and share specialised expertise to other engineers.
* Familiarity with REACH compliance and environmental impact of their work.
* Strick adherence to GE Zero Deviation policy and promote EHS within the team.
* Occasional international travel for testing supervising, suppliers visit and internal meetings.


The Person:

* The candidate will probably be educated to degree level or equivalent in Mechanical Engineering, Energy Engineering or Chemical Engineering.
* Candidates should have proven experience of the design and/or development of the liquid cooling systems (ideally for power electronics applications).
* It is key that the candidate has the ability to work quickly and efficiently within an engineering team.
* In addition to relevant experience, an enquiring mind and desire to learn new skills together with an ability to motivate and engage the cooling system engineering team are essential qualities.


Skills and Experience:

* The person will have proven experience in cooling systems, knowledge of heat dissipation and heat transfer, fluid dynamics, hydraulics, component design and selection, piping design, control system specification, instrumentation specification and selection.
* Proven ability in product design, validation and industrialisation.
* Design for X (DFX) (e.g. manufacturing, cost, size, weight, efficiency, performance, test, maintenance).
* Simulation tools such as Matlab\\-Simulink, Ansys.
* Ability to prepare P\\&ID drawings is essential and the ability to use 2D drawing packages to prepare GA and layout drawings is desirable.
* Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
* A good working knowledge of /ability to use a 3D drawing package (PTC Creo) is also desirable.
* Specification \\& report writing, reviewing and approval.
* Design \\& type testing programmes.
* Ability to interact with other engineering disciplines and good at sharing knowledge.
* EHS compliance ability.

**Advantageous Experience:**

* Knowledge / understanding of pure water cooling of high\\-power and high\\-voltage design and control issues.
* Prior experience of supplier chain integration (e.g. technical communication, clause\\-by\\-clause review, production line audit).
* Intellectual property and the patent process experience.
* Ability to coordinate and lead a small group of engineers.

**Specific Abilities:**

* Advanced leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills.
* Self\\-motivating, proactive and results driven approach.
* Excellent problem\\-solving and root cause identification skills.
* Able to work to deadlines with high quality.
* Ability to synthetize complex issues and come up with solutions.
* Proficient in the English language, written and verbal. Other languages are bonus.

**About Us:**


GE Vernova is a world leader in the energy solutions market with a portfolio of energy businesses across the globe. Grid Solutions provides equipment, systems, and services to bring power reliably and efficiently from the point of generation to end power consumers. We electrify the world with advanced grid technologies and accelerate the energy transition – and we want you to be part of that change and enjoy imagination at work.


If you are ready to make a difference and usher in a new era of clean, reliable energy, come join us.

**About** **GEV** **Grid Solutions:**


At GEV Grid Solutions we are electrifying the world with advanced grid technologies. As leaders in the energy space our goal is to accelerate the transition for a more energy efficient grid to full fill the needs of tomorrow. With a focus on growth and sustainability GE Grid Solutions plays a pivotable role in integrating Renewables onto the grid to drive to carbon neutral. In Grid Solutions we help enable the transition for a greener more reliable Grid. GE Grid Solutions has the most advanced and comprehensive product and solutions portfolio within the energy sector.

**Why we come to work:**


At GEV, our engineers are always up for the challenge \\- and we’re always driven to find the best solution. Our projects are unique and interesting, and you’ll need to bring a solution\\-focused, positive approach to each one to do your best. Surrounded by committed, loyal colleagues, if you can dare to bring your ingenuity and desire to make an impact, you’ll be exposed to game\\-changing, diverse projects that truly allow you to play your part in the energy transition.

**What we offer:**


A key role in a dynamic, international working environment with a large degree of flexibility of work agreements


Competitive benefits, and great development opportunities \\- including private health insurance.

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

jd:
At IN2, we’re a dynamic and forward\\-thinking engineering consultancy with offices across Ireland, the UK, and mainland Europe. Our mission is to create better spaces for people—delivering sustainable, efficient, and people\\-focused building design.

  

For over 20 years, we’ve fostered a culture where innovation, adaptability, and personal growth are at the heart of everything we do. We give our people room to develop, contribute meaningfully, and thrive—because we believe that great buildings start with empowered teams.

  

Now, as we grow our presence in Germany, we're looking for passionate professionals to join our award\\-winning MEP team and help deliver cutting\\-edge projects across Berlin and beyond.



About the Role

  

We’re seeking a talented Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our Berlin office during an exciting phase of expansion. You’ll collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers and technicians on a broad portfolio of projects—from commercial developments and residential schemes to cultural and healthcare facilities.

  

You’ll lead mechanical services design, mentor junior team members, and help shape the future of IN2 in Berlin. This role offers a real opportunity for career progression with a pathway toward Associate Director level and beyond.

  

Key Responsibilities


* Lead the design and delivery of mechanical building services including HVAC, water services, and public health systems
* Oversee project stages from concept to handover, ensuring quality and performance at every phase
* Work across a variety of sectors, bringing best\\-practice solutions to every brief
* Build strong relationships with clients, presenting ideas confidently and clearly
* Support and mentor junior engineers, fostering technical excellence and growth
* Drive innovation and sustainability in all engineering output
* Play a proactive role in developing IN2 Berlin as a key part of our European operation

  



What We’re Looking For


* Degree in Mechanical or Building Services Engineering (or equivalent)
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in mechanical design, ideally within a consultancy environment
* Strong technical knowledge of HVAC, water services, and building systems design
* Familiarity with German codes and standards is an advantage
* Experience working across various sectors and building types
* Excellent communication skills with a client\\-focused mindset
* Demonstrated leadership and mentoring abilities
* Chartered Engineer status or working towards it


Our Culture



We pride ourselves on having a welcoming, inclusive, and social team culture. From Berlin meetups to company\\-wide events like our legendary Christmas weekend, you’ll always feel connected to the wider IN2 community.

  

We also support a healthy lifestyle—with wellness initiatives, blood donation drives, and annual health checks as part of our company\\-wide wellbeing focus. Diversity and inclusion are at the core of who we are: everyone is encouraged to contribute and feel heard.

  

What IN2 Offers You



We support work\\-life balance and understand that flexibility is key. Whether you prefer being in the office or need a hybrid arrangement, we make space for what works for you.



You’ll also benefit from:


* Flexible working environment
* Additional annual leave for every year of service
* Ongoing training, CPD, and our structured Mentoring Programme
* Annual salary reviews
* Company bonus scheme
* Pension scheme
* Critical illness cover
* Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family
* Wellness programmes and company events


Join Us in Berlin



If you're ready to take your next step in a city at the heart of European innovation, and be part of a consultancy that puts people and the planet first—we want to hear from you.

IN2 is a leading MEP consultancy working across Ireland, the UK, and Europe. We design high\\-performing buildings that prioritise occupant comfort, energy efficiency, and long\\-term performance. From initial concept to detailed design and construction, our mechanical engineers are involved at every stage, helping to shape the built environment through smart, sustainable design.

  

Job Overview:



This internship is an exciting opportunity for an undergraduate student in Mechanical or Building Services Engineering to gain hands\\-on experience in a modern consultancy environment. You’ll work alongside experienced engineers on a wide variety of real projects, developing your technical knowledge while learning how MEP systems are designed, coordinated, and delivered on site.

  

Key Responsibilities:


* Support senior engineers in the design and specification of HVAC, water, and mechanical systems
* Assist with producing drawings, calculations, and reports for live projects
* Attend internal project and design team meetings to gain insight into multi\\-disciplinary collaboration
* Help review mechanical layouts using tools such as AutoCAD and Revit
* Participate in site visits and inspections to see how designs are implemented
* Learn about energy efficiency, compliance standards, and how sustainability is integrated into MEP design

  



Opportunities:


* Work on every stage of a project, from concept design to final handover
* Participate in the IN2 Academy, which provides technical training, soft skills development, and mentorship
* Build confidence in communication, time management, and problem solving
* Gain real\\-world insight into consultancy life and find your ideal career path within mechanical engineering

  



Qualifications:


* Currently studying Mechanical Engineering, Building Services Engineering, or a related field
* Strong interest in the built environment and mechanical systems design
* Familiarity with design tools such as AutoCAD, Revit, and Microsoft Office
* Excellent attention to detail and a proactive, can\\-do attitude
* Willingness to learn and contribute as part of a team

  



Benefits:


* Paid internship with exposure to live projects and real client work
* Career development through structured training and day\\-to\\-day mentoring
* Friendly and inclusive team environment
* Opportunity to explore full\\-time roles with IN2 after graduation

  



Equal Opportunity Employer:



IN2 Engineering is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

jd:
### **About the role**


Marketing Executive  



Where has your journey taken you so far?


* Are you motivated by results with a passion for the customer?
* Do you have a creative flair and innovative approach?
* Do you have experience of developing marketing or category campaigns?
* Do you want to grow your marketing skills?
  


Then why not make our journey your journey?



Play an important part in our journey



As a Marketing Executive, you will support the creation and activation of marketing campaigns designed to increase market share, drive revenue and support our customers’ growth plans within the coffee and catering supplier categories.


The category teams are responsible for developing the category buying, marketing and sales strategies that reflect current trends, supporting our customers to grow and our sales teams to open, grow and retain business.



The role supports the team by creating and delivering innovative marketing plans, including ownership of the collateral assets, websites, as well as liaising effectively with suppliers to ensure product representation is accurate and up to date. You will work closely with the sales, commercial team and suppliers to develop your knowledge of the industry and become an expert in your field. You will have the freedom to research, scope and create campaigns from the start to the very end and we’ll give you the support you need to grow your skills and develop.


**A bit about you**



Experience of developing marketing or category campaigns is desirable, plus an appetite to learn and develop your marketing skills and category knowledge. An English or Marketing degree or similar qualification is also desired but relevant experience will also be considered.



Creativity and strong organisational skills are a must for this role. You’ll need to bring your creative flair to the development of marketing material and creativity in your approach to developing innovative solutions for the customer. You’ll also need to be highly organised to prioritise your workload, manage sales requests and drive your marketing plans at the same time. We work in a very deadline driven environment so it’s vital that you have a flexible and planned approach.


You will need to be a confident presenter and excellent relationship builder. This role gives you amazing exposure to players across the hospitality market and it is essential that you show\\-case your learned expertise to them.


You’ll also need to be a skilled wordsmith, copywriting is a fundamental part of the role so you’ll need to enjoy writing and have fantastic attention to detail, taking the time to proof your work thoroughly.The ability to work with a personable approach is also key. You will be working with multiple stakeholders and it is extremely important that these stakeholders buy into your vision!



Finally, we pride ourselves on our specialist categories \\- you will need to have an interest in both food and non\\-food and be willing to support the wider team.  



  

### **About us**


Our journey began back in 1929\\. Since then, we’ve continued to build a strong and resilient business with a great future. It's why we believe we’re the best foodservice provider in the country.

**A journey that gives back**

We want your career with us to be as rewarding as possible. So, you’ll get lots in return for your hard work. That includes benefits that can support your wellbeing and financial security, and give you peace of mind.

**The essentials**
* 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) as a minimum and the opportunity to buy more
* A pension \\- contribute 4% and we’ll match you (after year 1, we’ll match your contributions up to 6%).
* Life cover that you can increase.
* Access to confidential support and counselling, when you need it.
* A health plan that gives you money back on everyday medical costs for all the family, as well as access to a digital GP.

**The extras**
* Exclusive range of high street discounts including cinema, tech, travel, fashion, food and drink.
* Get paid as you earn \\- access to up to 20% of your pay before payday.
* Opportunity to buy dental cover and critical illness cover.

**We want everyone to join our journey**

We’re on a journey towards creating the best possible workplace. We’ve got some way to go, but we’re building a diverse and caring workforce. One that’s filled with forward\\-thinking people who each bring unique talents and skills. So whatever your life experience, we want you to join us \\- and you really can come as you are!

The objective is to implement a strategic technical solution to support the governance and monitoring of break standards - including enhancements to audit capabilities. As a part of this program, the required remediation of source system data feeds involves consolidation of data into standardized feeds.

These remediated data feeds will be consumed by ETL layer. The reconciliation tool is
designed to source data from an ETL layer. The data from the Front and Back office systems,
together with static data must therefore be delivered to ETL. Here it will be pre-processed and delivered to reconciliation tool before the reconciliation process can be performed.

**Additional Information**  

**Job Number**25077969  

**Job Category**Sales \\& Marketing  

**Location**Europe Office \\- London, Barnard's Inn 86 Fetter Lane, London, London, United Kingdom, EC4A 1EN  

**Schedule**Full Time  

**Located Remotely?**N  

**Position Type** Management **JOB SUMMARY**


This position is responsible for the execution of defined services that supports the area and hotels digital business needs. The Digital Specialist Manager role is comprehensive and will ensure completion of defined tasks as requested by the Hotel Account Managers who oversee a portfolio of hotels. The role requires a focus on ensuring hotels are aligned to global compliancy, strategies and ensuring the activation across digital channels (Marriott.com, Mutlilingual global sites, EChannels(OTA’s), Segmental (F\\&B, Spa, etc.) and other marketing channels to maximise online presence and attribute to the hotels performance.

**CANDIDATE PROFILE**

**Education and Experience**

* 3\\+ years’ experience in an online agency or client services position is required or equivalent experience
* 2\\+ years’ experience in leading project teams and implementing digital strategies or equivalent experience
* BS/BA degree in marketing or related field or equivalent certification from higher education
* Strong workflow management skills and experience in Content Management systems
* Strong understanding level of online marketing and merchandizing
* Organized, detail\\-oriented and deadline\\-sensitive; takes initiative and anticipates needs
* Fluent French speaker, and based in either Eschborn or London

**CORE WORK ACTIVITIES**

**Managing Work, Projects, and Policies**

* Delivers against all aspects of the Digital Marketing program and associated services for hotels and the area.
* Maintain and update all Marriott.com Hotel Web Site content including marketing messaging, imagery, captions, links, PDFs, hotel alerts, etc.
* Conduct regular audits of Marriott.com Hotel Web Sites to ensure each hotel is optimized for high quality custom images, content, links, and accurate translations, and work with hotels on corrective action
* Support and guide hotels in developing hotel website modules and outlet sites for F\\&B Spa, Golf, weddings, where applicable.
* Manage the pull\\-through and activation of key corporate digital projects (e.g., new Marriott.com Hotel Web Sites, ERS, Corprate “e” services)
* Ensure Hotels online positioning is up to date and correct. (Yelp and GMB listings)
* Audit, manage 3rd party channel content scores and adjust and update to ensure optimal visibility.

**Marketing the Marriott.com Hotel Web Sites**

* Assure that hotel websites on Marriott.com and global sites are fully optimized to maximize traffic from search engines. Work with the Center of Excellence to coordinate Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) tactics and manage keyword strategy for hotels opted into Program.
* Work with hotel to execute online marketing activities, such as loading Marriott.com Hotel Web Site deals, Group Deals etc.

**Supporting Operations**

* Serve and pull through Continent \\& regional campaigns. This requires the approved solicitation of hotels participation with coordination of Hotel Account Managers.
* Coordinate and Ensure the development of tactical landing pages, testing and optimization of continent and regional campaigns with all specialists.
* Implementation and workflow process management of all content optimization requests for the digital field marketing teams.
* Manage the timelines and onboarding of new hotel hotels across the continent in terms of contracting and all account set up with support of specialists.
* Ensure expert training and support to hotels by working with managers to elevate digital knowledge.
* Support with defined project’s as outlined by the Senior Manager to ensure the overall performance of the team, its areas/markets and participating hotels.

**Relationships \\& Processes**

* Develop knowledge and work with vendors and agencies to improve turnaround and campaign execution
* Manage relationship with key vendors to drive scalability of efforts and implementation consistency (e.g. Digital HQ, Tripadvisor etc.) and platform development oriented at better tracking/conversion
* Execute all in\\-house campaign processes, including but not limited to campaign review, hotel billing, briefing, etc.
* Where appropriate, develop, support and implement new processes and track output to improve efficiency for the team.

**Additional Responsibilities**

* Attends and participates in all relevant internal and external meetings.
* Informs, updates, and provides information to managers and co\\-workers in a timely manner.
* Presents ideas, expectations and information in a concise, organized manner.
* Uses problem solving methodology for decision making and follow up.
* Maintains positive working relations with internal teams and department managers.
* Manages time effectively and conducts activities in an organized manner.
* Performs other reasonable duties as assigned by manager.

*Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people\\-first culture. We are committed to non\\-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.*


Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

jd:
We're looking for a talented SEO specialist to join our team. You'll manage your own list of clients and help them achieve their marketing goals through creative thinking, strategic insight and hands\\-on SEO expertise. Your day\\-to\\-day will include a wide range of SEO activities such as on\\-page optimisation, technical SEO, ecommerce SEO, international SEO, local SEO, auditing, keyword research, link building and collaborating on SEO\\-driven copywriting. You'll have the full support of a knowledgeable team and access to ongoing training tailored to your progression goals, so that you can continue to deliver outstanding digital results.

Here's what you can expect to be doing daily when you join our team:

* **Plan short and long\\-term organic strategies** in line with client goals. You'll be responsible for planning, prioritising, implementing and reporting technical, on\\-page and off\\-page organic SEO.
* **Implement optimisation tactics** that sit within your clients' budgets while considering user experience and brand strategy.
* **Work with the wider team**, including the copywriting, creative content, PPC, web dev and social teams, to create multi\\-discipline strategies, ensuring that everything we do works towards short and long\\-term objectives.
* **Communicate and report back to clients** on where we're at with their strategy, feedback on progress and discuss the next steps.
* **Develop and maintain long\\-lasting client relationships** by always doing what's best for them and communicating clearly.
* **Help to streamline internal processes** to improve the performance of our client projects. We are always eager to learn and improve.

**Essential Skills and Experience**

We're more interested in the person behind the role, but it would be invaluable if you had the following:

* At least 3 years’ experience in an SEO\\-orientated role, this could be in\\-house or agency side. You'll have the freedom to direct your strategies how you see best, so we'd love to hear about previous campaigns you've led on.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively liaise with clients, present strategies and explain performance data in a clear and engaging way.
* Experience in planning and implementing organic strategies. You'll be working with a great team of specialists across multiple disciplines to help you achieve fantastic things for your clients.
* Attention to detail. So you can get to the heart of what your clients want and need and implement plans to achieve them.  

Good numeracy, written and verbal skills.
* Proficient in Google Analytics and Google Search Console. We can help you learn and deepen your knowledge; however, we do ask that you know the basics already.
* Proficient in Word and Excel and similar tools so that we can send all key information to clients in an accessible format.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a growing team.
* A mindset for continuous learning. We're looking for someone who loves to keep up with best practices, technology, and tools.
* Quick\\-thinking. While we all work together to get the best results possible, you will have full autonomy and responsibility for your SEO accounts.
* Working knowledge of digital tools such as Screaming Frog, Sistrix, Sitebulb, SEMrush, KWFinder and more.


**Additional Skills**

These aren't essential, and we offer training as part of this role; however, we'd love to hear if you have the following:

* An undergraduate degree in marketing, media, communications, or other creative disciplines such as English or similar.
* Good understanding of HTML and CSS.
* An accreditation in Google Analytics, Google Ads and similar.
* An understanding of digital data and how to creatively represent it to give your client full transparency and understanding of how their SEO campaigns are performing.
* Experience working with Woocommerce Wordpress websites may be beneficial, though we have clients across a range of CMS platforms.
* CRO experience and an understanding of how to convert website users into customers or leads.

**Who We Are**

The Digital Maze is an agency that has grown via the acquisition of 3 well respected and growing agencies within the midlands
* Frogspark
* Boom Online Marketing
* Evolve Retail


  

We are a Strategic Performance Marketing \\& WordPress/WooCommerce agency dedicated to driving growth for Home \\& Garden, Lifestyle, D2C, SaaS, and Service brands with £5M–£50M in revenue. Our flexibility caters to businesses at different stages, offering tailored solutions that drive sustained growth.
  

With over 30 years of agency expertise and a track record of driving over £800m in trackable revenue, our dedicated team blends the latest technology with data\\-driven insights and deep market knowledge. Fully accredited at the highest level, we deliver custom solutions that transform plans into measurable results. Trusted by top brands across the Home \\& Garden, Lifestyle, D2C, SaaS, and Service industries, we turn strategic visions into tangible growth.

The whole business is an approximately 30\\-strong team of professionals working in:
* SEO
* PPC
* Web Design \\& Development


  

**Benefits**

Here's what you can expect to get when you join our team:

* 25 days holiday per year, plus bank holidays.
* Free day off for your birthday.
* Profit share bonus scheme.
* Yearly salary of £32,000 \\- £36,000, depending on experience.
* Annual pay reviews.
* Workplace pension.
* Cycle to Work scheme.
* Hybrid working (remote \\& office). We ask that you visit the office on a weekly basis. If you'd like to come in more often, our office is available for you to use as much as you'd like too though!
* Excellent career progression within a growing business.
* Enhanced sick pay.
* Enhanced Maternity pay.
* Home setup; Monitor(s) \\& Apple equipment.
* Company\\-paid social events throughout the year.

**Our Values**

At The Digital Maze, we operate on five main values:

* **Thinking big** \\- We think big and long term, taking our clients on a continuous journey of growth.
* **Customers, first** \\- We focus on getting a return for our clients, producing work we're proud of that shows your passion and creativity.
* **Committed \\& empowered** \\- We are careful and considerate about what we commit ourselves and our company to. Each of us has ownership and pride in our vision and work.
* **Talking straight** \\- We are open, smart, and direct but operate with humility.
* **Having fun and celebrating** \\- We acknowledge the great results our team achieves every day, celebrating their efforts and accomplishments.

We want to continuously improve everything we do and are always open to suggestions from our team. We're committed to creating a fair and enjoyable workplace regardless of gender, race, religion, background, or anything else and will continue working to make this industry better.

**If you're passionate about SEO and want to build your career while delivering excellent client results, we'd love for you to apply for our SEO Account Manager position.**

Join our professional and fast\\-growing medical aesthetic clinic in Aberdeen as a Part\\-Time Sales \\& Marketing Executive. This is a key role for someone with creativity, initiative, and a passion for aesthetics.

We offer advanced, in\\-demand treatments such as anti\\-wrinkle injections, dermal fillers, Morpheus8 skin tightening, Sunekos skin boosters, and more. Your mission will be to increase our brand reach, attract new clients, and support the clinic’s growth.

Key Responsibilities:

* Create and implement local marketing strategies and promotions
* Identify and approach potential clients and local collaboration opportunities
* Plan and attend events, open days, and community promotions
* Manage and grow our social media presence (Instagram, Facebook, etc.)
* Develop content including posts, videos, reels, and client testimonials
* Monitor marketing performance and help drive consistent sales growth

Requirements:

* Proven experience in sales, marketing, or social media management (preferably within aesthetics, beauty, or wellness)
* Confident, professional, and outgoing personality
* Excellent communication and people skills
* Strong content creation skills (e.g., Canva, Reels, short videos)
* Highly organised and self\\-motivated, able to work independently
* A genuine interest in the aesthetics industry and understanding of treatments like Morpheus8 and Sunekos is a bonus

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a supportive team and make a real impact in a flexible part\\-time role.

To apply, please upload your CV and a short cover letter via Indeed explaining why you’d be a great fit.

Job Type: Part\\-time

Pay: £30,000\\.00 per year

Expected hours: 15 – 20 per week

Additional pay:

* Commission pay

Benefits:

* Company pension

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: art\\-Time Sales \\& Marketing Executive – Medical Aesthetic Clinic

jd:
**Head of Content (Social\\-First)****About Campfire**



Campfire is a social\\-first marketing agency that helps brands break through by creating content that actually works on social—not repurposed ads, not TV\\-style creative, but real, platform\\-native content that people want to engage with. We specialise in influencer marketing, organic social, and content creation, working with some of the biggest brands in beauty and beyond.



We don’t believe in one\\-size\\-fits\\-all content. Every platform has its own culture, trends, and mechanics—and we create content that **fits, not fights, the platform**. That’s why we produce everything from **fast\\-turnaround lo\\-fi TikTok content** to **high\\-production\\-value social shoots**, always through a **social\\-first lens**.

  


**Role Overview**



We’re looking for a **Head of Content (Social\\-First)** who truly gets social media—someone who instinctively understands the cultures, styles, and formats that make content succeed on each platform. This isn’t about just making ‘good content’—it’s about making **the right content for the right platform at the right time**.



You’ll lead Campfire’s **content team**, shaping our creative approach, pushing our work to new levels, and ensuring that every piece of content we produce is **designed to perform**—whether it’s a raw, reactive TikTok or a high\\-end shoot designed for maximum impact on Instagram. You’ll be hands\\-on with strategy, execution, and talent development, ensuring our content is not just visually strong, but **culturally on\\-point, platform\\-native, and results\\-driven**.

  


**Key Responsibilities****Creative Leadership \\& Strategy**


* **Define and drive Campfire’s creative approach** to social\\-first content, ensuring we create work that **feels native to the platform, not adapted for it**.
* **Develop content strategies** that balance **lo\\-fi, creator\\-led formats with high\\-end, premium production**, always keeping social\\-first principles at the core.
* **Stay ahead of platform changes and trends**, ensuring our clients are always ahead of the curve—not catching up.
* **Push the boundaries of what social\\-first content can be**, championing a mix of reactive, trend\\-driven creativity and long\\-term brand\\-building storytelling.


**Content Creation \\& Execution**


* **Oversee the production of both fast\\-turnaround, lo\\-fi content** (TikTok trends, short\\-form video, reactive content) and **high\\-production shoots optimised for social\\-first performance**.
* **Work closely with influencers and creators** to develop highly engaging content that feels **authentic, platform\\-native, and in tune with audience behaviour**.
* **Ensure that every piece of content is designed to perform**—not just to look good, but to **drive real engagement, reach, and action**.
* **Lead on experimentation**, constantly testing new content formats, styles, and techniques to refine our approach.


**Leadership \\& Team Development**


* **Manage and mentor a team of social\\-first content strategists, writers, and creators**, helping them develop cutting\\-edge skills in content production and platform strategy.
* **Foster a culture of speed, creativity, and experimentation**, ensuring we move fast and create work that leads the industry.
* **Ensure we have the right mix of talent and resources** to deliver both high\\-volume, fast\\-moving content and more considered, high\\-production\\-value shoots.


**Collaboration \\& Client Engagement**


* **Work closely with clients** to help them understand what truly works on social (and challenge them when needed).
* **Collaborate across departments** (strategy, influencer, paid, organic) to ensure content is maximised across all relevant platforms.
* **Be a thought leader in social\\-first content**, both internally and externally—pushing for better creative thinking in the industry.


**What We’re Looking For**


* Someone who **lives and breathes social**—you naturally get what works on TikTok, Instagram, and beyond, and you understand the **platform\\-specific mechanics of content performance**.
* A deep understanding of **how to balance lo\\-fi, creator\\-led content with high\\-production\\-value storytelling**, always keeping social\\-first in mind.
* A **proven track record of leading social\\-first content teams**, whether at an agency, brand, or creator\\-led environment.
* Experience in **managing both fast\\-moving reactive content and structured, high\\-end content production**.
* A **data\\-driven creative mindset**—you understand not just what looks good, but what performs.
* Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to **build and inspire a high\\-performance team**.
* The ability to **confidently challenge clients and internal teams**, ensuring we always push for the best social\\-first creative possible.


**What Success Looks Like**


* Campfire is known for **creating the best, most effective social\\-first content**—whether that’s a trend\\-driven TikTok, a polished campaign shoot, or anything in between.
* Our clients see real results—**higher engagement, deeper audience connection, and measurable business impact**.
* Our content team operates at a world\\-class level, **balancing speed, creativity, and strategic thinking**.
* We’re not just reacting to trends—we’re **setting them**.


**Campfire isn’t looking for a traditional creative lead—we’re looking for someone who** **sees social as the main event****. If that’s you, let’s talk.**

\\- Experience as a creative executive
\\- Experience working with other departments such as casting, production, research, PR, business and legal affairs
\\- Experience overseeing all creative aspects of development production and post production
  

Amazon Shopping Videos (ASV) is seeking a customer\\-obsessed branded content leader with a proven track record of creating innovative video formats with brand partners in the digital, linear, social, and streaming TV space. Your in\\-depth knowledge of the advertising landscape and your project management skills will enable you to build innovative shoppable solutions for brands in International markets and the US. This is a hybrid role that will work on both pre\\-sale ideation and budgeting as well as post\\-sale execution with in\\-house or external partners. To be successful in this role a candidate must think outside the box but work within business parameters which requires a solid understanding of hard costs associated with each creative idea. Candidates must be comfortable with ambiguity and possess a strong bias for action and appetite to test and learn. This role will index high on communication skills and Earns Trust as working across teams within ASV (marketing, monetization, product, finance, legal) and within Amazon is essential to meet goals.
Key job responsibilities
\\* Own trackers of projects in pre\\-sale, production, and post\\-production.
\\* Identify opportunities for efficiency and develop mechanisms to simplify communication and workflows.
\\* Manage multiple projects in various stages of the activation lifecycle.
\\* Analyze client briefs and work quickly to respond with bar\\-raising creative concepts.
\\* Write pitches, campaign overviews, scripts, run of show documents, and data\\-driven campaign retrospectives.
\\* Build budgets, source production partners. Negotiate terms with vendors and make tradeoffs that yield the highest creative quality while maintaining budget. 
\\* Provide creative feedback on pitches from external or internal partners. 
\\* Oversee campaign execution on set, give notes on video edits, and manage final asset delivery.
\\* Input into monthly and quarterly business reviews shared with leadership as well as annual planning documents.
\\* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders from production, marketing, legal, product, monetization, finance and PR.
\\* Present confidently to org leadership but work at all levels in the organization, with no job being considered too large or small.
A day in the life
No two days are the same in this role. You will have the opportunity to invent on this team by creating new workflows and lead bar\\-raising creative activations. You will report to the Head of Creative Development and work closely with ASV’s Pre\\-Sales and Brand Success teams as we scale our offerings for ad partners in international markets. You are as comfortable drafting pitches and building decks as you are managing on\\-set production and presenting strategy documents to senior team leaders.
About the team
It’s an exciting time to be on Amazon's Video Shopping (ASV) team. Now more than ever, customers watch videos when they shop. Videos and livestreams make shopping easier and more fun, whether a customer is researching a product or tuning in to chat with their favorite content creator live. The Amazon Shopping Video (ASV) team’s mission is to enable customers to find inspiration, information, entertainment, and community through videos at any point in their shopping journey. If you are interested in building an entertainment product, enjoy a creative and fast\\-paced working environment, and want to work on a strategic new initiative, join our team today!
  

* Knowledge of the US media landscape
* Experience working as a producer, creative executive, or a similar role

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\\-we\\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

**HOMES** 
 Brewery \\& Campus is a vibrant hub for food, beverage, and hospitality in Ann Arbor, featuring a nationally‐acclaimed production brewery, brewpub, commissary kitchen, coffee shop and roaster, as well as events and catering. With a dynamic, high\\-energy atmosphere, our community attracts thousands of visitors each year.
   

  

 As
 **Social Media Assistant** 
 , you'll support our Community Manager in fostering authentic engagement, telling our story, and amplifying the HOMES experience online. Your execution\\-focused mindset and fresh, curious perspective will help translate on\\-site moments into shareable content that resonates with our guests and community. This role is a perfect opportunity for a college student or someone seeking a summer or part\\-time gig to build a resume in marketing and social media
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Detail\\-oriented and dependable, with a passion for bringing brand stories to life
* Curious and attuned to emerging trends, with a fresh set of eyes for how guests perceive and engage with our content
* Comfortable working within a manager\\-driven framework and following clear guidelines
* Eager to learn and grow your skills in content creation, analytics, and community engagement
* A team player who thrives in a collaborative, hospitality\\-focused environment


**What You'll Do**
* Execute Content with Precision
+ Create, edit, and schedule posts, stories, and reels from an approved content calendar
+ Use your curiosity to spot trends and suggest micro\\-content ideas for Manager approval
+ Ensure every piece of content reflects HOMES' brand voice and values

* Engage Our Community
+ Monitor comments, messages, and mentions; respond using pre\\-approved tone guidelines
+ Flag any sensitive or strategic inquiries for Manager review

* Track \\& Report Performance
+ Review metrics with Community Manager on a weekly basis
+ Highlight trends, guest sentiment, and content ideas for Manager consideration

* Maintain Quality Control
+ Submit all draft content and partnership proposals for Manager approval before publishing
+ Keep an organized approval workflow to ensure timely, error\\-free posts

* Support Cross\\-Team Initiatives
+ Assist with on\\-site event coverage by capturing photos and videos as directed
+ Help prepare basic promotional materials and support other departments' content needs

* Develop Your Skills
+ Participate in structured learning sessions on digital tools, editing, and analytics
+ Present any new ideas or improvements to your Manager for review


**Requirements**
* 1\\-2 years of social media or digital marketing support experience (internship, campus org, or entry\\-level)
* Proficiency with scheduling platforms (Later, Hootsuite, Sprout Social, etc.)
* Basic photo/video editing skills (Adobe Creative Cloud, Canva, or equivalent)
* Strong written/verbal communication and an eagle\\-eye for detail
* A natural curiosity and fresh perspective to identify trends and understand guest viewpoints
* Ability to follow structured plans and thrive under manager guidance
* Positive attitude, a collaborative spirit, and a willingness to learn


**Benefits**
* Competitive pay with growth opportunities
* Optional health, dental, and vision insurance with company contributions
* Flexible schedule
* Employee perks across HOMES brands


**Pay:** 
 $18\\-23 per hour (based on experience)
   

  

**Employment:** 
 Part\\-time, hourly
